Title: Five Sainik school cadets qualify
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Five cadets of Sainik School Nalanda have been selected to represent the state at the national level in second stage state level science camp held at Keshav Saraswati Vidya Mandir in Patna on February 2. The cadets selected are Raja, Ankit Kumar Pandey, Shubhankar Kumar , Avrendra Kumar and Kushagra Ujjain.

They received certificates, trophies and cash incentives from the chief guest of the event, Shri Ram Jyotishi, a scientist of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR).

Altogether 240 cadets from Sainik School Nalanda appeared in the online examination for ‘Vidyarthi Vigyan Manthan’ conducted in December 2019. The competition is organized at three levels. The online examination was the of first level.

A total of 128 students from Bihar were chosen for the state level camp, including 76 students of Sainik School Nalanda. Out of the 128 students who participated in the second phase, 12, including five from Sainik School Nalanda, have been selected for the third and final stage. Principal Col MI Hussain congratulated the cadets, parents and the staff.

Title: Ticks and mites cause infection, AES: Study
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A recent study conducted at Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) has held ticks and mites responsible for rickettsial infection, which can lead to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in children. Over 150 children in the state, primarily in Muzaffarpur district , died of AES last year.

A research done by PMCH paediatrics department head Dr Anil Kumar Jaiswal, as a part of study under Indian Council of Medical Research, revealed that around 20% children suffering from AES had rickettsial infection. House dust mites and ticks are the carriers of the germ which causes this infection which led to AES in some of the kids.

“Ticks and mites are the vectors and can be found in blankets or dust in the house. These are the carriers of the germs, which causes rickettsial infection,” said Dr Jaiswal.

The research study has also been published in International Journal of Contemporary Paediatrics.

Samples of 400 children suffering from AES were sent to King George’s Medical College in Lucknow for the test, which was done by Dr Anita Jain. In around 20% of the samples, rickettsial infection was found to be the cause behind AES in kids.

“Symptoms like fever, convulsion and alteration of senses happen in rickettsial infection, which are found in kids suffering from AES,” said Dr Jaiswal.

He added: “AES is not a disease, but a symptom which happens due to various reasons. One of it is Japanese Encephalitis. There is also a theory that it occurs due to toxin from litchi, for which there are no medicines. But the good thing is that we have medicine to fight rickettsial infection and it has been included in the protocol of the state government.”

However, paediatricians also said rickettsial infection cannot be termed as the universal cause behind AES as it had been established in only 20% of the samples. Indian Academy of Paediatrics vice-president Dr Nigam Prakash Narain and Dr Jaiswal said: “Hypoglycaemia was the common cause in all the cases and children who were malnourished and from lower income group were the common sufferers. There is also a theory that toxin from litchi had caused AES which is true in few cases. Hence, rickettsial infection does not hold true for all the AES cases.”

AES outbreak in June last year had killed over 150 children in the state. Though various reasons have been tabled till now, small kids from poor family have been dying every year in summer due to it.

Title: Cows grace marriage ceremony in Surat
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

This was a unique marriage ceremony where besides band, baaja and baarat, there were bovines too.

SURAT: This was a unique marriage ceremony where besides band, baaja and baarat , there were bovines too. At a swanky party plot located in posh Vesu, a couple took ‘saath pheras’ in the presence of two cows and two calves.

Rohit Garodia, 29, who is pursuing PhD in business administration, married Abhilasha, 28, a chartered accountant, with Hindus Vedic rituals. The cows and the calves were kept near the wedding mandap where the duo took the marriage vows.

Before the wedding, a procession was taken out in Vesu area, which was led by the cows and the calves. The first entry at the wedding venue was given to the cows and that the invitees and the couple followed them.

The wedding ceremony was based entirely on green concept. The marriage invitation cards were made digitally and sent through WhatsApp and email to save paper. Also, the guests at the wedding were served with water and other refreshments in kulhars. There were steel utensils to serve food to the guests.

Rampal Garodia, father of Rohit, said, “Tradition of marriage in the presence of cows is very old and we followed the same. We hope that people in our community will follow this tradition by giving a special status to the cows in marriage ceremonies.”

Garodia added, “All our invitees are happy that we started this new tradition of marriage. I met many of our relatives and friends who are so inspired by the tradition that they have decided to perform the marriages of their sons and daughters in the presence of cows.”

Sudhadevi Garodia, mother of Rohit, said, “Our wish has come true after all these years. We were waiting for this day for last many years. Me and my husband decided to perform marriage of our son in the presence of cows more than 10 years ago.”

Sushil Agarwal, textile businessman and a relative of Rohit, said, “It was a very different experience to attend a marriage ceremony in the presence of cows. I have seen cows munching over leftover food after marriage ceremonies. Here, they were not only given fodder to eat, but a separate space near the mandap for showering their blessings on the newly wedded couple.”

Title: Bihar to aid in branding and promotion of export items: Sushil Kumar Modi
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi addressing during State Credit Seminar at Gyan Bhawan in Patna

PATNA: Deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi (SuMo) on Monday said that the state government would “actively intervene” to promote exports from Bihar, which currently languishes at a miniscule 0.05% of the total exports from the country. The state would help in branding of products from various districts to create demand for them in the international market, he added.

“PM Narendra Modi has asked the state governments to make necessary interventions to promote exports of products and items from their respective areas,” SuMo Modi said, referring to a recent meeting addressed by the PM in which he had participated.

SuMo was the keynote speaker at seminar on ‘State Focus Paper 2020-21’ related to the annual credit plan prepared by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD). He said, “8.74 lakh metric tonne (MT) of food items worth Rs 1,748 crore were exported from the state in 2017-18 was, but it could be increased to Rs 9.35 lakh MT valued at Rs 2,500 crore.”

SuMo drew the attention of the bankers at the seminar to the annual credit plan that had allotted Rs 292 crore for disbursement among exporters from the state. “Come forward and assist them, so that more products and items could be exported from the state, which, in turn, would also increase the state’s share in the total exports from the country,” he told the bankers.

The deputy CM added that one product or item would be identified from each district for branding and its “pull-value” in the international market would be created. Among the items that he cited for identification were ‘katarni chawal and chura’ from Bhagalpur, fruits (shahi litchi, Bhagalpuri silk and ‘malda’ mango) and sweets as well as handicraft items and Madhubani paintings.

Currently, the largest share of exports from the state belongs to non-basmati rice (32%), followed by maize (29%), cereal (9.3%), wheat (6.1%), ‘makhana’, as well as fresh vegetables and honey. “The need is to do proper branding and maintaining their quality,” SuMo said.

Animal husbandry department’s principal secretary, N Vijayalakshmi, said production of fish in the state has recorded highest growth in the recent years.

“For long, Bihar remained a fish consuming state for which varieties of fish used to come from states like Andhra Pradesh, but the state is now turning into a fish producing state,” she said, adding, the gap between fish import and production in Bihar was merely 44,000 tonnes which would be overcome in the next fiscal..

Title: Budget took care of Delhi's traders: PM Modi
Content:
PM Narendra Modi

NEW DELHI: In a bid to woo the traders and middle-class voters, Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated a major part of his speech to the tax reforms undertaken by his government in the Union Budget The Budget will help the youth of the country, women, traders, middle and lower-middle class people and the poor. It will open new avenues of development and employment in the capital, the PM claimed. “Earlier, businesses with a turnover of Rs 1 crore had to be audited, but now no audit is required for all businesses with a turnover up to Rs 5 crore,” Modi said, adding that it was an example of the government’s trust in traders and entrepreneurs of the country, including those in Delhi.The trading community in the capital, traditionally BJP supporters, holds immense sway and is an influential voting bloc. They are believed to be unhappy with the government post demonetisation and the hasty implementation of the GST has left many traders high and dry. The PM, in his rally , appeared to be healing the old wounds of the traders.For the first time, the PM said, the IBC legislation has been passed to give entrepreneurs a dignified exit from businesses. “It has been BJP’s efforts to reduce problems of traders and enable them to carry out their work freely,” he said.The Prime Minister assured the people that multiple provisions have been made in the Budget for tax holidays for startups and that middle-class taxpayers save money. He stated that the central government has also addressed previous complaints from the traders about tax authorities giving them a harrowing time. “Our government has started indirect tax settlement scheme, which has saved countless traders from legal cases,” Modi added.

Title: Taxpayers approach CAs to understand new tax regime
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

PATNA: Chartered Accounts (CAs) in the state capital are busy explaining the new two tax regimes to the taxpayers in the state following announcement by Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget speech last Saturday.

The CAs claim people were asking about the difference between the newly introduced flat tax regime, which offers lower tax rates and the itemized deduction system being followed at present.

Rajesh Kumar, a chartered accountant, said: “I have received more than 40 queries in the last two days. People are not sure whether to switch to the new tax regime or stick to the old one. Those who have just started their career should definitely consider switching to the new tax regime and start fresh as they do not have much to lose.”

Amit Bhatacharya, chairman of Patna branch of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI), said: “If we compare both the slab rates, the previous one is better for people who have made long-term and big investments.”

Terming the new slab rates as an “eyewash”, ICAI (Patna) vice-chairman Mukul said: “Earlier, investments like in LIC were promoted in the country. Not only did it benefit the common people but the government as well. With the change in slab rates, people will stop investing in policies like LIC. It is not good for the economy.”

He added: “Earlier, people had options to use their investments for paying loans, in case of losing jobs. Now, they do not have any such option.”

Meanwhile, many taxpayers are still struggling to understand the new tax regime and making a choice. “Even after going through the Budget 10 times, I couldn’t figure out what’s exactly the point of making so many changes. The government should have taken measures in profitable sectors instead of making common people, who have invested 75% of their earnings, rethink about their decision,” said Amish Kumar, manager of a private firm.

“Earlier, demonetisation and now the new income tax regime. The government, with its every step, is showing its approach towards common people. The optional income tax regime came as a shock as it would completely kill investments. Being a mutual fund investor, I am not able to understand what step to take next,” said Uma Shankar Prasad, a businessman.

Gyan Prakash, an adviser in LIC, said: “Those who have made big investments should stick to the old tax slabs. However, people with small investments should go for the new one. The older regime will result in lower tax outgo compared to the new regime with lower rates.”

Ram Shankar, chairman of Patna branch of Central India Chartered Accountant Students Association (CICASA), said: “The most important scheme this time is the “Vivaad se Vishwas”, which is the tax dispute settlement scheme, under which a taxpayer who pays the disputed taxes before March 31 this year would get renunciation of interest and penalty. Besides, there are pre-filed tax returns for individuals in the new tax regime.”

Title: Bookworms talk peace, politics at city’s fave fair
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

The 44th International Kolkata Book Fair , which is being held at Salt Lake’s Central Park, has something for everyone. From bringing back memories of lost heritage to highlighting the current political issues, the fair has once again ticked all the boxes. And cops are keeping an eye out for troublemakers so that every guest at the fair has a good time.

Walking postbox

There was no mistaking the giant inflated postbox walking around at the book fair. At a stall put up by the postal department, officials said that efforts were on to popularize India Post through innovative schemes — including shaking hands with the postbox, posing for a photograph for a postage stamp and buying bottled gangajal. One can even buy silver pendants engraved with motifs. Officials were spotted trying to explain to visitors why it is “cool” to buy books at the fair and “speed post” them to friends and family living out of state. Even postal savings schemes were being advertised. “These are times of targets,” an official explained. On Monday, a special postal cover and cancellation, a special envelope cover and metal seal to commemorate the 44th book fair were released.

Books on current situation

The rhetoric against NRC and CAA was palpable at the little magazines pavilion where a large number of publishers had come out with special books and magazines on the citizenship issues. Two volumes published by the People’s Study Circle — ‘Nijer Deshe Refugee Hobo’ and ‘Ei Banglar Udbastu’ — have caught on with the public. Among the other stalls, Akinchan, Ayna Nagar and RB Enterprise drew a lot of visitors for their anti-CAA books and journals on Monday.

Push for peace

It was heart-warming to see camaraderie between people managing the stalls of Viswa Hindu Parishad and Ahmadiya Muslim Jamat — located opposite each other. Waqar, one of the managers at the Jamat stall, held up a Bhagvad Gita that he bought from the VHP stall. “We are trying to promote peace here. All religions teach the same thing and, to us, our Quran is just as important as the Geeta,” said Shahbaz Munim.

Kids try story-writing

On Monday, school children took up the open air arena set up by Janapriya Prakashani, a yesteryear kids’ publication, to read books and try their hand at writing stories. There was a quiz on books and other fun sessions too, along with prizes for the participants.

Two held for harassment

Two men were arrested from the book fair on Monday for misbehaving with women. The victims raised an alert, allowing cops to nab the accused immediately. Officers said they were keeping watch on the gathering every day and monitoring the area through CCTV cameras. Cops said they will deploy more woman personnel in plain clothes who will mingle with the crowd and be ready for any untoward incident.

Cuffs on pickpockets

Six pickpockets were arrested from inside and outside the book fair since Sunday. Two were arrested from the grounds while the rest were picked up from the bus stand nearby. The accused, cops said, usually targeted women who were carrying large bags. Cops said they suspect the accused could be part of a Mullickbazar-based gang that frequented fairs and functions. Officers said raids against such criminals would continue at the fair.

Title: KMC reclaims Dhapa for scientific waste disposal
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Kolkata: Unable to find an alternative ground to dump waste as large as Dhapa , the Kolkata Municipal Corporation has decided to continue with the existing facility but after scientifically reclaiming it in phases.

Adopting multi-pronged strategies to combat the ill-effects of hazardous waste at Dhapa, the civic solid waste management department has started reclaiming portions of the dumpyard, so that those areas could be reused after creating sanitary landfill, said Debabrata Majumdar, member, mayor-in-council, overseeing the department.

During a visit to Dhapa, TOI found multiple machines scooping out chunks from high piles of waste and taking them to a compost plant, where the waste is recycled into fertilizer. “We have started reclaiming a part of the Dhapa ground since January 16. These scooped-up chunks are transported to a factory, where the waste is screened and segregated. After segregating plastic and the likes from biodegradable waste, the latter is sent to a separate unit to produce organic manure from it,” said a KMC solid waste management official.

As the KMC is determined to reduce health hazards from the Dhapa dumping ground, a search for an alternative land is also on. “Going by the present rate of reclamation, it will take much long to reclaim the entire 23 hectares of Dhapa. We need an alternative land that could be set up with a sanitary landfill facility to take the load off Dhapa,” a KMC official said. The civic body has stopped dumping waste on 12 hectares of land in the crore Dhapa area. The portion has been beautified and a green zone created there.

A civic official pointed out that the capacity of the compost plant would be enhanced soon. “In the first phase, we are recycling 300 tonnes of garbage a day. The capacity of the compost plant will be increased to 900 tonnes a day in three months,” he said.

The official said 100 tonnes of manure were produced from 300 tonnes of wastes every day. This apart, the compost plant, set up on a PPP model, receives 500 tonnes of biodegradable waste collected from Kolkata households every day.

A section of KMC officials, however, felt the success of the project of reclaiming the Dhapa ground would depend on fruitful implementation of waste segregation at the ward level. “We have recently started waste segregation at households in 20 KMC wards. The number will go up by another 100 by the end of the year. Only then will we be able to prevent the pollution being generated from the hazardous waste dumped at Dhapa,” said a KMC solid waste management official.

Title: SMC planning survey for allotment of space to vendors
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

According to street vending law, one third portion of footpath in a specific area can be allotted to street ve... Read More

Surat: Of the approximately 60 ,000 street vendors and food cart owners in the city, only 28 ,000 have got themselves registered until now. Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) is planning to end the chaos caused by vendors and food cart owners at many places in the 326 sq km area under its limits. SMC has drawn up a plan to accommodate 1,000 vendors in Rander zone, Katargam zone and Limbayat zone under National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM).

A town planning officer said, “The issue of street vendors is complex. We will be appointing a consultant to carry out a survey before allotting space to registered vendors in 2020-21.”

Jaylal, president of Jagte Raho, a non-government organization, said, “SMC is bent upon choosing wrong locations to allot space to the vendors. A vendor must be located at a place which saves a consumer’s time, fuel, money and also helps reduce traffic congestion. If a vendor is located on a road which is near consumers’ houses or offices, they can buy the required things on the way.”

As per the street vending law, one third portion of footpath in a specific area can be allotted to street vendors on a permanent basis. The problem is the vendors refuse to move out from the place where they are located on the premise it will affect their business.

Jaylal said, “All food carts must be located at consumers’ doorsteps. They could be allotted spaces on ancillary roads near the residential localities. For a critical issue like this, town vending committees must be set up. SMC has constituted arbitrary committees without proper representations of people concerned.”

Title: Surat students glitter in CA-F results
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

with flying colours

Surat: Students from the Diamond City have come out with sparkling performance in the chartered accountancy foundation (CA-F) course, results of which were announced on Monday.

Among the top 50 in the country, 30 are from Surat. It is for the first time that so many students from the city have secured place among top 50. Many students have shared the same rank as per their marks across the country.

CA-F is the entry level exam to qualify for CA course and students who wish to do the course after class XII they have to clear the exam. Students mostly prepare for a year to appear in the exam and it was held in November 2019. According to the tutors from city, around 60% students out of nearly 1,500 who appeared in the exam have cleared this year.

“Comparatively, it is a good result in CA-F and for the first time so many students have secured place among top 50 in country. Total 27 of my students are among the top 50,” said Ravi Chhavchharia, a tutor.

CA-F format was introduced in 2018 and it replaced common proficiency test (CA-CPT). The first CA-F course exam was conducted in November 2018 and its results announced in February 2019 in which 15 from city were among top 50.

“Compared to the over CA-F result which is around 35%, Surat students’ performance is very good. A good number of students have cleared the exam from city,” said Adiya Jhavar, a tutor.

Apart from CA-F, many students from city secured place among top 50 in CA-intermediate course as well. “Surat has developed expertise in CA coaching and availability of coaching for all subjects under one roof helps students prepare well,” Chhavchharia added.

Title: L&T MBDA Missile Systems sets up facility in Coimbatore
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Chennai: L&T MBDA Missile Systems (LTMMSL), on Monday, set up a missile (inert) integration facility at Tamil Nadu’s Defence Industrial Corridor — Coimbatore, in joint venture with MBDA which owns 49%. The first complete missile systems for export markets will be ready in CY2020.

The facility, in which systems integration process takes place without explosive component of the missile systems, is spread across an area of 16,000 square meters in a Special Economic Zone in Coimbatore. The facility will cater both domestic and international markets, with missile sub-systems and missile weapon launch systems, including the Indian Armed Forces in exploring prospects under the Buy (Indian – IDDM), Buy (Indian), and Buy and Make (Indian) categories for Defence procurement. L&T MBDA Missile Systems’ Chairman JD Patil said in a statement: “We have been working proactively to offer advanced missiles and missile systems to the Indian Armed Forces through domestic production. The creation of this new integration facility at Coimbatore is a first step in this direction.” LTMMSL has also responded to Indian Navy’s Air Defence requirement for Short Range Surface-to-Air Missile System (SRSAM). Going forward, the JV will offer the Exocet MM 40 Block 3 anti-ship missile, and the 5th Generation Anti-tank guided missile (ATGM5) to the Indian Armed Forces, which has already entered the service in France. ATGM5 will be an Indian Designed, Developed and Manufactured (IDDM) product, which involves transfer of key technologies to India.

Title: BPCL partners Kinetic & IIT M, enters EV space
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Chennai: State-owned oil refiner BPCL on Monday said it has forayed into electric vehicles space in partnership with Kinetic Green energy. BPCL will use its vast network of nearly 12,000 fuel stations to offer fully charged automotive batteries for e-vehicles on a swappable basis.

In this model, to begin with, the three wheelers would be owned by Kinetic Green while BPCL will provide Lithium Ion batteries under support from IIT Madras.

Three wheelers would be sold without batteries by Kinetic (to begin with in Lucknow and Kochi).

“The three wheeler (autorickshaw) cost without batteries will be Rs 1.3 lakh as against a CNG powered one which costs Rs 2.2 lakh. It will be lower than Internal Combustion Engine vehicles. The cost of a diesel delivery rickshaw is Rs 3.5 per km while that of battery operated will be just 50 paise,” said Sulaja Forodia Motwani, CEO, Kinetic Green Energy.

“Today we have forayed into EV space with e-drive in Kochi and Lucknow. It is the first of its kind in India and opens up a new customer segment for BPCL. The batteries, charging stations, IT infrastructure, mobile tech have all been developed by IIT Madras. It will be a new revenue stream and business potential for BPCL,” BPCL’s CMD D Rajkumar said. The Kinetic-BPCL solution has already been implemented in a fleet of vehicles in Kochi and Lucknow. The vehicles under the swappable platform are deployed near high traffic metro stations and offer last mile connectivity to passengers at just Rs 10. “By removing the battery from the capital cost, we made it affordable,” said Professor Ashok Jhunjunwala, Centre for Betterry Engineering for Electric Vehicles (C-BEEV) at IIT Madras.

Title: Municipal councillor’s husband arrested on graft charges
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Surat: Palkesh Patel , one of the accused in a graft case and husband of Congress municipal councillor Kapila, was arrested by anti-corruption bureau (ACB) sleuths on Monday. Palkesh and his wife were on the run since December 10, 2019 after a businessman was caught accepting bribe on their behalf from a builder.

Palkesh surrendered before ACB sleuths after which he was arrested. In his complaint, the builder earlier alleged that Kapila and Palkesh had demanded bribe from him. Police had arrested Hitesh Patel for allegedly accepting the bribe on behalf of the couple.

Kapila, a municipal councillor of ward 18 Anjana – Khatodara area, had filed a complaint in Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) against the builder seeking demolition of his construction project for alleged violation of norms.

The accused demanded bribe from the builder to withdraw the application but he was not willing and approached ACB.

“Palkesh had earlier approached sessions court and high court for anticipatory bail, but didn’t get compelling him to surrender,” said an ACB officer.

Title: Telangana high court fumes over illegal highrises on govt land
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: The Telangana high court on Monday came down heavily on revenue officials over widespread illegal structures on encroached government plots and also pulled up the state government for being in deep slumber while its own land was slipping out of its hands.

Addressing the state government, the bench cautioned it against being misled by officials. “Do not rely on whitewashing techniques of these revenue officials who try to get away with evasive replies as and when such irregularities surface,” said Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan while dealing with a PIL by K Krishna Goud on the failure of officials in preventing encroachment of 3.22 acres of government land at Gandhamguda area in Gandipet mandal of Rangareddy district.

When revenue department counsel Bhaskar Reddy said that officials were planning to survey the land to ascertain if there was any truth in the allegations, the bench of CJ Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy said: “Whenever a PIL is filed on encroachments, officials tell us that they too have realised about the illegality only now and that they would act on it soon.” Describing this as an official eyewash to get out of sticky situation, the bench added: “The less said about such techniques of these officials, the better.”

The bench also brushed aside the contention of the counsel for the revenue department who was insisting on 3 months to complete the survey of government land in Gandipet area. It gave the state a month to complete the survey.

“Officials know that state land is being occupied and illegal structures are coming up,” the CJ remarked and sought to know from the state what steps were being taking to arrest this malicious trend which has led to scores of illegal buildings sprouting in various parts of Hyderabad.

Title: American hockey eves take home piece of Jharkhand
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Ranchi: Sixteen female hockey players from USA, who had come to Ranchi from the US to bond with their tribal counterparts at a six-day special hockey training camp, on Sunday went back to their country and took back with them what they termed as “cherishable” memories with them. The hockey eves, accompanied by a female coach from Middlebury College of Vermont was in Ranchi as a part of sports-based training-cum-awareness camp which was jointly organised by the US Consulate General in Kolkata and Shakti Vahini, a Delhi-based NGO working in the field of anti-trafficking.

The purpose behind the exchange programme, according to officials, is to sensitise tribal girls against issues of human trafficking and gender-based violence using sports as a means. The six-day camp, which concluded on Saturday, was held at South Eastern Railway Sports Association (SERSA) stadium. Sharing her experience, one of the visiting players, Joan Viera said, “It was a very good experience to play and bond with the girls here. We learnt several new things about their sports, culture, practices etc. We also shared many sweet memories and made many new friends.”

Another girl, Grace Harlen, said, “It was an entirely new experience for me to be in a completely different place and spend time with girls here. It will always be a memorable trip for me and we are going back with a lot of cherishable memories.”

Assistant secretary of US Department of State for Educational and Cultural Affairs (ECA) Marie Royce, who was present during the concluding ceremony of the programme said, “We believe that the power of cultural exchange through sports is transformative. Participation in sports also teaches leadership, teamwork, and communication skills that help young people succeed in all areas of their lives.”

As many as 110 tribal girls, many rescued after being trafficked, from districts like Chaibasa, Khunti, Simdega and Gumla, attended the camp. Officials informed that five of the participants from the 110 girls will be awarded scholarships to travel to Middlebury College in April 2020 to participate in field hockey matches under a cultural exchange programme.

A Class X student, Priya Kerketta from Simdega, said, “The camp was fun-filled and I enjoyed a lot. I learnt many new techniques of the game from them.” Poonam Toppo from Gumla said, “I always wanted to play hockey. During the camp, I learnt new ways of rolling and different types of passes.”

Another Gumla girl, who was rescued a year ago, said, “I now go to school regularly and aim to become a hockey player so that in the future, I can get a job through sports quota and also play for the state or the country.”

Title: Entrepreneurs earn R76L at Mahila Udyog Mela in 5 days
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

PATNA: Products worth Rs 76 lakh were sold at the five-day Mahila Udyog Mela , which concluded at the Indira Gandhi Planetarium on Monday. Altogether 70 stalls, selling embroidered clothes, bamboo art, handmade jewellery, exotic plants and home décor items, had been put up at the fair.

Women entrepreneurs from different parts of the country, including Uttar Pradesh and Jharkhand, participated in the fair organised by the Bihar Mahila Udyog Sangh (BMUS).

Speaking at the concluding ceremony, mines and geology department principal secretary-cum commissioner Harjot Kaur Bamhara said, “These days, women are attaining new heights in every field. Earlier, there were limited options for them, but now, the situation is different.”

BMUS president Usha Jha thanked the women entrepreneurs from different parts of the country, including the rural areas, who took part in the fair. “Small scale industries are often ignored as they are not given much importance. The Mahila Udyog Sangh, on the other hand, always motivates and helps small entrepreneurs earn a decent income and showcase their marketing skills,” she said.

A large number of visitors thronged the fair on Day 5 and bought a wide range of products. Boring Road resident Siya Singh, who purchased an embroidered suit, said, “There are so many items to choose from. I bought reasonable dresses for my brother’s wedding.”

Another shopper, Aman Sinha, said, “This was my first time at the fair. The home décor items, especially the ones made of bamboo, were really good.”

Title: Another Afghan arrested for getting passport on fake IDs
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Kiramatullah Ahmadzai

Varanasi: After arresting Afghan national Abid Abdullah in Varanasi and his local aide Sahabe Alam in Azamgarh on Sunday for trying to procure Indian passport on fake documents, the Azamgarh police arrested another Afghan, Kiramatullah Ahmadzai, in Kolkata for procuring Indian passport on forged documents. The police brought him to Azamgarh on Sunday evening and sent him to jail on Monday.

Azamgarh SP Triveni Singh said that during interrogation Sahabe Alam divulged that he had helped Kiramatullah also in getting Indian passport on forged documents, and that he was presently in Kolkata to procure Visa for UAE. Following this revelation, a police team was sent to Kolkata immediately to nab Kiramatullah.

A sub-inspector and a constable of Phoolpur police station were suspended for negligence in duty in this regard, said the SP.

The police have recovered fake Aadhar card, residential certificate, affidavit copy, voter identity card and an Indian passport from Kiramatullah. He was booked under sections 419 (cheating by personation), 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 467 (forgery of valuable security, will), 468 (Forgery for purpose of cheating), 471 (using as genuine a forged document or electronic record). of IPC and 14 Foreign Act 1946 and 12 Passport Act.

During interrogation, Kiramatullah confessed that he used forged documents arranged by Sahabe Alam to get Indian passport in the name of Mohammed Tahir Alam, a resident of Charadih village in Phoolpur police station area of Azamgarh. Sahabe Alam had called him and another Afgani Abid Abdullah to arrange Indian passports against the payment of Rs 25,000 and 20,000, respectively. After getting passport, he went to Kolkata to apply for Visa while his friend was in Varanasi to get the passport when he was arrested.

Earlier, the Varanasi police had arrested Sahabe Alam on Sunday from Azamgarh and Abid Abdullah on January 31 from Passport Seva Kendra in Varanasi.

Title: Unable to find bride, Jamnagar man ends life
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Himanshu Bhensdadia was suffering from depression

Rajkot: Frustrated at not being able to find a suitable partner for marriage, a man hanged himself to death from an electricity pole in Rampara village of Jamnagar taluka on Sunday night.

The deceased was identified as Himanshu Bhensdadia (29), a resident of Moti Banugar village of Jamnagar taluka.

“In his statement, Himanshu’s father Jivraj said that his son was suffering from depression as he was not being able to find a partner for marriage,” said P H Parmar, head constable with Jamnagar Panchkoshi A division police station.

Himanshu was a farmer, and used to jointly farm land with his father.

Title: Year-round policy sales point to lower tax impact
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Rachel Chitra | TNN

Bengaluru: Sales of life insurance policies may not be hit as badly as feared due to the Budget announcement allowing assessees to opt for a lower rate of tax by foregoing tax breaks on investments such as insurance. Industry experts say tax breaks for investment under Section 80CCC of the Income Tax Act are no longer the driver and buyers are choosing insurance for protection and tax-free returns on earnings.

One indicator of the dependency on investment tax breaks is the bunching up of purchases around March 31. This has gone down over the years, as investors now have a wider variety of tax-saving investment options available.

In 2015, over 35% of the premium from new policies came in the quarter ended March. This has dipped to 27% in 2019, indicating sales are more spread out.

The fourth quarter of 2019 saw Rs 73,089 crore (27%) sales in the first-year premium from the new business out of total premium of Rs 2.67 lakh crore. This compares to fourth-quarter new business sales of Rs 44,142 crore (34%) of the total premium of Rs 1.24 lakh crore.

If one looks at the month of March only, the volume of business done has dipped to 14% of total sales in 2019 from 18% in 2015. Tax will not be the only deciding factor, say companies. PolicyBazaar CEO Yashish Dahiya says, “Our insights tell that consumers don’t buy these products for tax benefit alone. This Budget will validate these insights, as we believe it’s time the middle class bought insurance for its real benefit, which is protection.”

There are others, who say they will most likely retain their client base as the old tax regime would prove more beneficial to them. “Our initial analysis suggests that it is beneficial for taxpayers to continue investment in life insurance policies for claiming tax exemption under Section 80C as it would be beneficial with less tax outflow in the year in which premiums are paid. Additionally, tax exemptions under section 10(10D) of Income Tax Act would continue against the amounts received from life insurance companies,” says Prashant Tripathy, MD and CEO, Max Life Insurance .

Tax planners also say it is unlikely millennials would opt of insurance for a few thousand rupees in tax savings. “Most people in their 30s and 40s would already have an ongoing life insurance policy for Rs 20-30 lakh. Some even take Rs 1-crore policies. Now for a tax-saving of Rs 10,000, it is unlikely they will opt out of policies and lose the benefits on them,” says S Neelakandan, a chartered accountant and tax planner.

“People new to insurance might go for the new tax regime. But the majority of the salaried class — whatever else they opt out of (mutual funds, FDs, PPFs) — life insurance they are unlikely to. This is a life risk — and a very personal decision. The money is whatever they are leaving for the family if something happens,” adds Neelakandan.

Title: NGO unearths ‘violations’ in MSEDCL underground cabling
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Nagpur: Civic Action Guild Foundation (CAG), a non-profit organization from Dharampeth, has alleged substandard work in cable laying work done by Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Ltd ( MSEDCL ) across the city.

In a letter submitted to the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) in New Delhi, CAG stated that MSEDCL is laying underground cables across the city from last three years but it is not being done as per the Indian Standard (IS) norms. “The PMO has asked the Maharashtra principal secretary to look into the matter,” CAG member Nachiket Kaley said.

The underground cabling works is being carried out under the Integrated Power Development Scheme (IPDS) of Government of India and standard operating procedure needs to be followed as per IS-1255 (1983) specifications.

“On inspecting some sites, we observed that the norms are not being followed. This was brought to the notice of top officials of MSEDCL, Nagpur. MSEDCL constituted a two-member committee, re-dug only three sites and reported that the works all across were carried out as per the norms,” Kaley said.

According to Kaley, when the NGO registered a strong objection, the authorities agreed to open up sites of their choice. “In the presence of authorities and the contractor’s representatives; we reopened a site in front of high court,” Kaley said.

The joint survey revealed substandard work. MSEDCL’s spokesperson too admitted that many discrepancies were found in the work done by the private contractors.

The excavation of trench was not done as per the norms laid down under IPDS. The trench dug up was found to be 27 inch deep while norms says it should have been 54 inch deep. Even the RCC done for covering the cable was of substandard quality.

The joint study also found sand was missing from the trench. As per IS 1255, it is necessary to place 75mm sand bed under the cable and 75mm above. This was totally missing at the site, pointing to negligence by the executing contractor.

The back filling was carried out with the excavated soil containing material not permitted in the norms as they might damage the cable in the near future.

MSEDCL spokesperson claimed that the shortcomings have been had rectified through the said contractors. This, however, exposed that MSEDCL engineers, who were supposed to monitor the work, are ignoring their work. The spokesperson said that if they again receive any complaint they are ready to inspect the sites.

Shortcomings

* Excavation of trench not done as per the norms laid down under the IPDS scheme

* Even the RCC done for covering the cable was of substandard quality

* Sand was missing from the trench

* Back filling was carried out with excavated soil

Title: Pramerica’s Rs 4,100cr claim for DHFL rejected
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Mumbai: The insolvency professional (RP) for troubled housing finance company DHFL has rejected a Rs 4,100-crore claim submitted by Prudential International Insurance Holding — the bankrupt company’s partner in life insurance and erstwhile partner in asset management. The RP while releasing the list of admitted claims said the claim was rejected as no documentation was submitted for substantiating the claim.

Pramerica Life Insurance India is a joint venture between DHFL Investments, a wholly-owned subsidiary of DHFL and Prudential International Insurance Holdings. The rejection of the claim indicates the US insurer has not been able to resolve the shareholder issue in its life insurance JV — Pramerica India. Prudential has been trying to find a new partner in place of DHFL, which had turned insolvent following its inability to meet its debt obligations.

“Nor was any explanation on the basis of which the claims have been calculated is provided. The factors considered in determining the claim amount are speculative in nature and do not meet the requirement prescribed under the applicable law,” the RP said.

In the previous year, Prudential Global Investment Managers (PGIM), the US insurers asset management arm bought out DHFL from its mutual fund joint venture. However, a similar buy-out was not possible in life insurance, which is subject to foreign limits. DHFL also had a non-life insurance company, which was promoted by its promoter Wadhwawan Holdings. The promoters exited the non-life business by selling out to Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal for around Rs 100 crore.

Former Indian Overseas Bank MD R Subramaniakumar, the RBI appointed administrator for DHFL, had verified claims amounting to Rs 86,035 crore of which around Rs 5,000 crore were from fixed deposit holders. The administrator has sought bids for DHFL either in entirety or any one of three parts of its business. The parts include retail loans, SRA projects and wholesale loans.

Title: GHIAL to operate Bidar airport from this month
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Hyderabad: Beginning this month, GMR Hyderabad International Airport Ltd (GHIAL) will “commission, operationalise and maintain” the civilian enclave at Bidar airport in Karnataka, a release by GHIAL on Monday stated. Initially, the airport will handle one daily flight between Bidar and Bengaluru.

GHIAL authorities said the concession agreement, to manage Bidar airport, has been signed under the UDAN (Ude Desh Ka Aam Nagrik) scheme and operations will commence in the first week of February.

“The operationalisation of Bidar Airport is a testimony to our commitment to support the Government of India’s flagship regional connectivity Scheme. We are very pleased to partner with the Government of Karnataka to support efforts for all-round development of Bidar and nearby regions and we are confident that the start of commercial operations will provide a boost to the local economy through better connectivity for the people of Bidar and the large number of tourists who visit the area,” said S G K Kishore, executive director (South, GMR Airports) and CEO, GHIAL.

Title: Lioness drowns in farm well
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Rajkot: Carcass of an adult lioness was found from a farm well in Jasadhar range of Gir east forest division on Monday. It is believed that the lioness died of drowning. According to forest officials, the carcass of the lioness aged 5-7 years was found from the open well in the farm of Ramesh Madhu in Shana Vankiya village of Jasadhar range. The carcass has been sent for the postmortem at Jasadhar animal care center.

Title: It’s a contest between patriots and Shaheen Bagh supporters: Amit Shah
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Union home minister Amit Shah at an election rally in Karala on Monday

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah on Monday said the Delhi assembly election is a clear contest between patriots under Prime Minister Narendra Modi and people who oppose the Citizenship Amendment Act and support Shaheen Bagh .

Speaking at a public meeting organised in support of Master Azad Singh, the Mundka BJP candidate and brother of former Delhi CM Sahib Singh Verma, Shah said, “Desh par jo ungli uthayega, usko munh tod jawaab Narendra Modi sarkar degi (Whoever points a finger at the nation, the Modi government will give a resounding answer to them).”

“When people of Delhi go to vote, they should keep in mind that this election is between two ideologies. On one side are Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal , who do appeasement politics for vote bank and are with Shaheen Bagh. On the other, there is BJP under PM Modi, which is a group of patriots who want to ensure the development and security of Delhi and the country,” Shah added.

Promising to remove Lal Dora and development in unauthorised colonies once voted to power, the BJP star campaigner said, “Modiji has a plan ready for these colonies. But we need to be in power in the state to make it a reality. In Delhi, people living in jhuggis will get two-room flats built under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. There will be paved roads, streetlights, proper drainage, gardens and libraries. But for that we need a BJP government in Delhi.”

“We will give scooters to poor college-going girls, bicycles to primary and secondary school girl students and flour to poor at Rs 1 per kg up to 5kg per person. We don’t make false promises. We say it and we do it. Our government is going to form in Delhi and I assure you that both the central and state governments are going to make Delhi the best capital in the world,” the home minister said.

Shah also addressed meetings at Sadar Bazar, Rajendra Nagar and Chirag Dilli and attended a roadshow at Karol Bagh. At Sadar Bazar, he assured that CAA was not meant to take anyone’s citizenship.

“These people (Congress and AAP) instigated our Muslim brothers and sisters that your citizenship will go away. I have said this many times. Citizenship will be given to refugees under CAA, not taken away from anyone. These people (refugees) have as much right here as you or me. You tell me whether we should give them citizenship or not,” Shah said, stressing on the fact that in Delhi, one-third of the people are refugees from Pakistan.

Attacking the AAP government, Shah said all development claims by them were lies.

Title: Bihar: Rs 134 crore sanctioned for 13 road projects in 11 districts
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The road construction department (RCD) on Monday sanctioned Rs134 crore for 13 projects in 11 districts of the state.

RCD minister Nand Kishore Yadav said in a statement that the funds were sanctioned for widening and strengthening of the roads. Funds to the tune of Rs28.88 crore have been sanctioned for three projects in Patna. Approval has been given for construction of road from Maujipur to Daulatpur with an estimated outlay of Rs4.96 crore. He said Rs10.25 crore will be spent on construction of a road from Sikariyan to Imamganj.

Besides, road widening and strengthening schemes have been sanctioned in several other districts, including Saran, Saharsa, Darbhanga, Madhepura, Bhojpur, Rohtas, Sheikhpura and Gopalganj. “The total length of the roads to be taken up for widening and strengthening under the sanctioned projects is 111km. The projects are targeted to be completed in 15 months,” he said.

Deliberating on other projects sanctioned by the bidding committee, the minister said Rs35.88 crore has been sanctioned for two projects related to NH-327E. Similarly, several stretches of NH-85 in Gopalganj district will be strengthened and widened with an estimated outlay of Rs20.34 crore. Funds to the tune of Rs5.74 crore have been sanctioned for similar works on NH-84 in Buxar district.

Similarly, Rs4.09 crore has been sanctioned for realignment works on the Vanavdharla-Ekma stretch of Saran-Siwan NH-85. Also, funds to the tune of Rs5.97 crore have been sanctioned for redevelopment and strengthening of the road between Sarahi Mor and Airport Mor in Saharsa.

Funds to the tune of Rs21.39 crore have been sanctioned for Jagur to Supal road on NH327E in Madhepura district and 4.79 crore will be spent for strengthening of Beda-Darshandih-Raipur road in Rohtas district. Also, Rs4.71 crore has been sanctioned for Ara-Ekaina-Khaira-Sahar road.

“Instructions have been issued to ensure quality and timely completion of all projects,” the minister said.

Title: Bihar: Boy shot over dispute during idol immersion
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

BIHARSHARIF: A dispute over immersion of an idol of Goddess Saraswati at Manipur village under Kesar police outpost of Ariyari block in Sheikhpura district enraged some youths, who fired several shots at the priest performing the rituals before immersion on Sunday night, which hit the priest’s minor son killing him on the spot and injuring his brother critically .

According to police sources, some youths fired several shots at the village priest, Dinesh Pandit, after some dispute over immersion.

The bullets hit Pandit’s 14-year-old son Pankaj Pandit and his brother Saroj Pandit. Pankaj died on the spot, while doctors referred critically injured Saroj to PMCH after first aid at Sheikhpura hospital.

“Police arrested the main accused identified as Dhirendra Patel, while two other suspects Deepak Kumar and Brijnandan Kumar are absconding,” said inspector Akhilesh Prasad.

Title: Bribe-for-publicity: Congress demands probe in Rajkot
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

The alleged ‘bribe-for-publicity’ scam that has rocked the Rajkot collector’s office has exposed the dirty un... Read More

RAJKOT: The alleged ‘bribe-for-publicity’ scam that has rocked the Rajkot collector’s office has exposed the dirty underbelly of politicians, media and administration nexus that has almost become an accepted norm. While the Rajkot collector and the BJP insisted that there was no wrongdoing in handing out hefty payment cheques to local scribes as advertisement payment, the opposition Congress has alleged that government itself was openly promoting corruption and demanded a detailed investigation.

The Rajkot collector’s office had allegedly distributed cheques of Rs 50,000 each to eight print media organization and some of them were issued in name of individual journalist of concerned media organisation.

The payment, according to district officials, was made with intention to get publicity of it’s state level event organized to celebrate the Republic Day. The three-day state level function had started from January 24.

District collector Remya Mohan could not be contacted for comment but addressing media persons on Sunday, she had said, “Cheques were issued from fund raised through public participation to celebrate a public function. There was no government grant used in making payments to the media houses. The amount was given through account payee cheques to publish the three days schedules of the events and get good coverage.”

“The intention was to get wider publicity of the program scheduled to obtain maximum public participation during the state level Republic Day function,” she had added.

However, according to sources no proper procedure was followed to place an advertisement in the publications like issue of release order. It has also been alleged that district administration tried to publish ‘paid news’ in the newspapers by giving ‘bribes’ to the journalists.

Rajkot city Congress president Ashok Dangar said, “This is open corruption. Chief minister (Vijay Rupani) himself had admitted last month that corruption was highest in the revenue department. Rajkot collector has now proved it.”

“The district administration had forcefully collected the fund for the Republic Day celebration from the builders and contractors and used it the way they wanted without being accountable,” alleged Dangar, demanding independent probe in the matter.

However, BJP spoke person Bharat Pandya reiterated that there was no bad intention behind the decision. “All payments were done through cheques. The relation between the administration and media is based on trust and co-operation. The district administration tried to maintain transparency in the process. The Congress has no right to make allegation,” Pandya said defending the Rajkot district administration.

Title: Lion scare on beach near Porbandar
Content:
cap

TimesView The expanding lion’s population is a wake up call for the forest department to carefully monitoring their movement as it’s a challenge to provide them passage through the towns and human habitats. The forest department is already engaged in lion conservation, but the second step is to make a long-term plan to ensure landscape management to accommodate expanding lion population.

Tourists throng Madhavpur

RAJKOT: Asiatic lions have caused a major scare near Madhavpur, one of the sought-after beaches of Gujarat , barely 60 km from Porbandar.On Sunday morning, a lion, believed to be around 5-7 years old, preyed on a green sea turtle that had come to lay eggs on the sea shore of Madhavpur. Madhavpur is an import turtle breeding and conservation centre.While the incident happened some eight km from the actual beach, wildlife experts and forest department officials said chances are strong that the lions could come well close to Porbandar.Interestingly, forest officials said that the lion crossed the coastal Mangrol town to reach this beach. The lion was sighted somewhere between Madhavpur and Antroli in reserve forest area.Talking to TOI, deputy conservator of forest, Porbandar, DJ Pandya said, “A pride of lions has made a permanent home along Mangrol and Veraval coast. We believe that this lion has came here after crossing the urban habitation in Mangrol town. It has likely walked nearly 25 km to reach this spot.”Priyvrat Gadhvi, a member of state wildlife board, said, “This is the fall-out of expanding lion population. In the last five years, increasing number of lions are venturing near human habitations. First it was only farms, but now they have also started crossing town.”“It’s only a matter of time that lions may soon identify dogs are their potential prey,” he added.According to experts, lions might be exploring a new territory or merely searching for prey.Chief conservator of forest (wildlife circle) DT Vasavada said, “This is the second time in the last six months that lions have ventured in this area. We are tracking their movement and activity to ascertain if the pride wants to make this a new habitat.”The Madhavpur beach, 60 km from Porbandar, is extremely popular among tourists, mainly because of its mythological importance. It’s believed that Lord Krishna married Rukmani here. The local Mer community members also organize a fair every year to celebrate this marriage.

Title: OnePlus leads in premium segment
Content:
(File photo)

BENGALURU: Chinese smartphone player OnePlus has emerged as the leader in the overall premium smartphone category (handsets of over Rs 30,000), taking over the market dominated by US major Apple and Korea’s Samsung for the last two years. OnePlus had 33% market share in 2019, while Samsung trailed with 26% and Apple with 25%, according to data from Counterpoint Research.Chinese smartphone marker Xiaomi (28% share), along with three brands owned by BBK Electronics — Vivo, Realme and Oppo (combined share of 35%) — already rule the overall smartphone market as they focus on the Budget segment competing with the likes of Samsung (21%). OnePlus is also part of BBK Electronics, which lets its brands operate independently with separate teams.“Given that a large share of the consumer segment in India still remains heavily offline based, we are working towards extending OnePlus’ unique premium brand experience to retail customers through OnePlus Experience Centers, which have played a crucial role in the brand’s growth,” OnePlus founder Pete Lau told TOI. The company plans to expand the total number of OnePlus stores from 30 to 100 by end of the year, as it looks at the offline segment to drive further growth. It also has a presence in another 2,000 stores through retail partners.While India’s overall smartphone market has seen its growth slow from 10% in 2018 to 7% in 2019, the premium smartphone segment is growing faster. While the ultra-premium segment, smartphones over Rs 45,000, grew at a record pace of 63% partly because of increasing iPhone shipments the premium segment also saw a 29% growth. This comes at a time when India has emerged as the second-largest smartphone market in the world, next to China. It overtook the US in 2019. At around 158 million smartphone units shipped in 2019, India beat US’ shipments of 153 million by a margin of 5 million even as China is experiencing declined in shipments, according to Counterpoint.OnePlus said that it shipped over 2 million smartphones in 2019 in India, helped by increasing new launches and entry in the ultra-premium segment. According to its India head Vikas Agarwal, 20% of the demand for its products came from users shifting from iPhones to Android OS. The country accounts for a third of the revenues for the brand, which has also made India an R&D hub, which it plans to scale up from 250 employees to 1,000 in the next 2-3 years.“Apart from being the largest market for OnePlus, India also has the most vocal user-base. India has always exceeded expectations and we have undertaken several India-first initiatives,” added Lau, pointing to OnePlus TV and operating system features.

Title: JD(U) and RJD eye Burari seat in Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: Politics of Bihar has virtually shifted to Delhi where JD(U) is contesting two seats while RJD is in the fray in 4 out of the 70 assembly constituencies going to the polls on February 8.

CM Nitish Kumar and RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav are camping in Delhi. HAM(S) and LJP are also testing electoral waters there.

JD(U), which is contesting with BJP and LJP, has fielded Shailendra Kumar from Burari and Dr SCL Gupta from Sangam Vihar. RJD is also in the fray from Burari besides Kirari, Uttam Nagar and Palam in alliance with the Congress. LJP is contesting from Seemapuri reserved seat where it has fielded Santlal Chawaria.

JD(U)’s Shailendra Kumar, from Sampatchak in Patna district, is pitted against AAP’s sitting MLA Sanjeev Jha, a native of Madhubani in Bihar, and RJD’s Pramod Tyagi, a local.

Gupta is fighting against Congress’s Poonam Azad, also a Bihari and wife of former BJP MP Kirti Jha Azad, and AAP’s sitting MLA Dinesh Mohaniya. Gupta was elected from Sangam Vihar in 2008 on a BJP ticket.

Nitish, who is also the JD(U) national president, along with LJP chief Chirag Paswan and BJP president JP Nadda (who is born and brought up in Patna) addressed a joint public meeting in Sangam Vihar on Sunday. Later in the evening, Nitish and Union home minister Amit Shah addressed a separate meeting in Burari.

Besides Nitish, more than half a dozen of his ministers are camping in Delhi to woo the voters of Bihar origin.

“Besides our ministers, majority of JD(U) MPs from Bihar and senior party functionary are campaigning in Burari and Sangam Vihar,” JD(U) national secretary Afaque Ahmad Khan told TOI over phone on Monday. He said JD(U) national secretary general K C Tyagi would campaign in Burari on Tuesday.

RJD’s Raghuvansh Prasad Singh on Monday campaigned in Burari, while Tejashwi held a roadshow in Palam on Sunday and is scheduled to hold an election rally in Burari.

Title: With 400 arrests, women’s squad scores a big win against harassers, snatchers and stalkers
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

The special all-women patrol has played a pivotal role since 2018 in curbing crimes against women on Kolkata ... Read More

KOLKATA: The special all-women patrol — Winners — that has played a pivotal role since 2018 in curbing crimes against women on Kolkata streets has arrested close to 400 people who harassed women. Following their example, two police divisions — the eastern suburban and south suburban — have now introduced special drives to combat such crimes at specific locations in the city. Police said, of all the arrests made by the Winners, 362 were related to making public spaces safe for women. Joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma shared a post on Twitter, congratulating the team over the weekend.

“Initially, we had asked two women cops to patrol the streets of Ultadanga . Both were in plain clothes with their male colleagues providing back up. The response was phenomenal and we extended drive to Narkeldanga, Beliaghata and Entally. Now this campaign will become a regular evening feature across important police stations in the eastern suburban division,” said DC (ESD) Ajoy Prasad.

Police sources said crimes against women tackled by the Winners have been varied. A few of the accused were trying to obtain the phone numbers of the women and persisting for links to their Facebook accounts when cops nabbed the accused. Several bikes were flagged down and checked. Some of the accused were arrested based on random checks at malls, offices and parks — areas which are seen as such criminals’ primary zone of operation. Police are investigating CCTV footage from these areas to develop a water-tight case against each of these accused.

Officers said initially, the Winners squad are concentrating on south and south suburban Kolkata, but they will soon expand their zones of operation with additional personnel joining the team. “We are expecting to efficiently use them across the city. The raids will be kept secret till the last moment and we will be scaling up operations as we head towards Valentine’s Day,” said an officer.

Commissioner Anuj Sharma had sent out a tweet last month asking citizens to report all incidents of women in distress by dialling 100. Cops said all efforts were being made to popularize the concept among Kolkatans and lately, #dial100 has been trending on Twitter.

Police have also asked all citizens to forward to the cops anything they find objectionable on the internet. “It is important that we stop trolling. It is harassment on the internet. Our social media team has been asked to respond to all complaints,” said an officer.

Title: NKDA to test compost made from organic trash
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

The test beds in New Town

KOLKATA: The New Town Kolkata Development Authority (NKDA), with the help of IIT Kharagpur , is setting up 12 test beds in New Town’s Patharghata area to test the quality of the compost that the NKDA authorities are producing by recycling organic waste. Officials and a research team inspected the spot last week.

Two composting machines — one at Street 45 near the market and another at the NKDA market in Action Area IC — process organic waste from the township. After processing, the brown, odourless substance is bagged for sale. However, authorities have noticed there are hardly any takers for the organic compost.

“The farmers seem to be hesitant to change their established practices of using conventional compost. They do not want to take a risk without carrying out any field trial. Only a few farmers have agreed to test a few bags of the organic compost to see if the product helped in plant growth,” said an official.

Each test bed will be 9m×9m. The entire process of analysing how well the compost helps in plant growth will take about three to four months.

Title: Surat: Video of drunk BJP councillor dancing goes viral
Content:
Piyush Jariwala

SURAT: In a major embarrassment for the Surat city BJP, a senior councillor from ward 19 was caught on the camera dancing in an inebriate state at a function held in Nargol near Umbergaon in Valsad.The video of Piyush Jariwala alias Piyush Shivshaktiwala, a BJP councillor from Sagrampura, had gone viral on the social media platform where he is seen dancing with his friends and that the liquor bottles are seen in the background.Following the controversy, the city BJP president Nitin Bhajiawala issued a show cause notice to Piyush Jariwala for giving a clarification on the video.Talking to TOI, Bhajiawala said, “A notice has been issued to Jariwala for clarifying his position. I talked with him over phone after receiving the video and he stated that it was very old and it was shot during a community function.”Sources in the party said that Jariwala belongs to the Khatri community and it is a custom to offer liquor to the guests. In some local communities hailing from Surat, people offer a glass of liquor even during the marriage functions and at funerals.Bhajiawala said, “On Monday he left for Mumbai to see off his family members at the airport. He is expected to return in a day or two. He will meet us to clarify his position.”When contacted, Jariwala said, “This video is very old and I don’t know who shot it and made it viral on social media. However, I have health issues and have the liquor permit. I consume liquor regularly. In our community drinking liquor is very common.”In Video: Watch: Gujarat BJP councillor seen dancing in inebriated condition, party seeks explanation
