Health department’s drug controller Raja Ram Sharma said, “The drugs were stored without licence and and permission. The seized drugs, mainly antibiotics and medicines used for medical termination of pregnancy, can be misused for intoxication.”

In one of the raids, a joint team from the drug controller office and narcotics department followed a truck from Transport Nagar which stopped at a residence in Gurjar Ki Thadi . When the officials raided the place, the workers of the drug store fled from the spot. The drug controller team called the narcotics department which found 20 boxes of medicines such as tramadol , alprazolam and codine formulation, which comes under NDPS Act.

The drug controller office estimated the cost of the seized drugs to be Rs 2.78 crore. The truck was carrying the MTP drugs worth Rs 20 lakh, the drug controller office said.

Another raid was conducted at Hamid Nagar colony where two godowns loaded with Tramadol, Alprazolam, Tramadol injection and codine phosphate worth Rs 25 lakh were found. Three persons were arrested. The drug controller also seized MTP drugs and amoxyclave of estimated cost Rs 13.5 lakh.

On January 31, the drug controller and narcotics department teams seized drugs of Rs 4.7 lakh from a firm at Roop Plaza Complex on New Colony Road which were allegedly stored illegally without any licence.

In the series, raids were conducted at three place in Jodhpur. The drug controller and narcotics department teams seized drugs come under NDPS Act worth Rs 15.7 lakh, Rs 60 lakh and Rs 29.5 lakh from Baldev Nagar , Shiv Nagar and Shanti Nagar Chaupasani.

This story is from February 4, 2020

Navlakhi Ground

Title: Owe it to MP for whatever I’ve achieved, says Salman Khan
Content: BHOPAL: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan , who was in Bhopal on Monday to officially launch the International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) Awards to be held in Indore in March, said that whatever he is today, is because of his relation with Madhya Pradesh . The superstar mentioned that he was born here and spent his childhood in Indore and went to school in Gwalior.Interacting with the media, Salman said that when he was first told that IIFA will be held in Indore, he thought the organisers were saying ‘indoor’ as it had not crossed his mind that the event can also be organised in MP.“When the organisers clarified that they were talking about Indore, it was a pleasant surprise for me. I was very happy,” Salman said.Speaking about hosting IIFA in the state, Salman said, “Since CM Kamal Nath is giving rebates on shooting films in MP, more and more producers and actors have started coming here. When a film crew comes to any city, we are just here with our 300 people and equipment. The resources and food are all provided by the state, which boosts economic activity. We also hire local artistes for roles and it has a huge impact on a city. The cities here have a lot of beautiful locations and when a city is featured in a film, the tourism of that place automatically increases.”Appreciating CM Nath’s energy and enthusiasm, the superstar said, “I cannot call him my elder brother and will have to call him my younger brother because he is a young CM for his young state. MP will not get a younger CM than him because he stands up to every occasion.”Actress Jacqueline Fernandez , who visited Bhopal for the first time said that she was looking forward to visiting the Tribal Museum and trying the local cuisines.“I did not expect the city to be so beautiful and clean. During my flight I was told that it is the ‘City of Lakes’ and when I landed, I was really surprised to see that Bhopal is so green. When I first heard about ‘poha-jalebi’, I was confused, but when I tried it here, it was simply delicious.”

Title: Meerut zone leads crackdown on PFI for alleged role in anti-CAA protests, 108 members arrested in UP
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Meerut: A total of 47 members of Popular Front of India (PFI) have been arrested in Meerut zone as police in region leads the crackdown in terms of arrests made in past 4-5 days. According to senior police officials, 75 members of the organisation have been identified as suspects and action has been taken against 47 in Meerut zone. Throughout Uttar Pradesh, police arrested 108 PFI members in the last four days for their alleged involvement in protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, a senior official said in Lucknow on Monday. The arrests are in addition to the 25 made earlier, additional chief secretary (Home) Awanish Kumar Awasthi told reporters.

“The way these protests turned and spread in sensitive regions of west UP districts, it was clearly premeditated and backed by the organisation. PFI’s name had emerged in the initial probe when inciting posters were found. The magnitude of these protests has also led us to links of funding by vested interests to promote unrest. We are looking at all angles in our probe and keeping a close watch on all suspects possibly involved in fuelling the protests,” Prashant Kumar, additional director general (Meerut zone) said.

In Meerut zone, which comprises nine districts, 21 PFI members have been arrested from Meerut, nine from Ghaziabad, 10 from Shamli, six from Muzaffarnagar and one from Hapur. Apart from the Meerut zone, 14 were arrested in Lucknow, 20 in Varanasi, 16 in Bahraich, three in Sitapur, four in Bijnor, five in Kanpur and one each in Gonda and Jaunpur.

In Bijnor, the four arrested were identified as Nassiruddin, Aarif, Dilshad and Idrees. According to the police, booklets and pamphlets with inflammatory content were recovered from them. Several booklets of cash receipts of donations sought were also recovered along with the incendiary literature.

“To avoid police surveillance, the accused used to communicate through WhatsApp chats and calls and used to seek donations through cash receipts. They wanted to turn the localities here into Shaheen Bagh,” an official press release from the police department in Bijnor said.

In December 2019, UP Police had sought a ban on PFI, suspecting the organisation’s complicity in the statewide violent protests against the CAA on December 20. “We have written to the Union home ministry, recommending that the PFI should be banned,” then UP DGP OP Singh had said.

The department had claimed that they had ample proof of PFI activists’ involvement in the recent violence. “We have evidence of PFI’s involvement in violence and mobilization of protesters. Not only have the outfit’s members been arrested from Lucknow, Meerut and Shamli, their role has also been ascertained through electronic footprint and data extraction technique,” Singh had said.

The PFI was formed in 2006 in Kerala as a successor to the National Democratic Front (NDF). Security agencies have alleged its leaders have been groomed in the SIMI ideology.

Title: Liquor addict attacks paternal aunt and cousin with iron rod, aunt dies
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Bijnor: A liquor addict attacked his paternal aunt and cousin with an iron rod while in an inebriated state in Bijnor’s Nehtaur late on Sunday. His aunt succumbed to injuries while his cousin is undergoing treatment.

Identified as Mohit Kumar, the man reached his paternal aunt’s house on Sunday night and allegedly started attacking her. When his cousin tried to intervene, he also attacked her, thereby injuring her. The police have arrested the accused and ordered a probe. The incident occurred at Talampur village under Nahtaur police station.

Superintendent of police (SP), Sanjeev Tyagi, said, “The accused is alcoholic and mentally disturbed. Prima facie it came to fore that he entered the house of his paternal aunt. He had an iron rod and attacked his aunt Kalawati (50). When his cousin sister Nita (22) came to rescue her mother, he hit her head with a rod.”

“When both mother and daughter shouted for help, neighbours came to help and informed the cops. Soon, Mohit fled. Villagers took the injured to community health centre at Nahtaur from where they were referred to Meerut. Kalawati succumbed to injuries while Nita’s condition is stated to be critical,” Tyagi said, adding, “Police have arrested the accused. He is being interrogated. Probe is on. A case has been registered.”

Title: Forest dept plans no fruit bat-coronavirus link campaign
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Meerut: Days after a youth allegedly killed a fruit bat perched on a tree near his house in Shivlok Colony here, believing that it is responsible for spreading the dreaded coronavirus, the forest division has taken up the task of launching a campaign to make people, especially schoolchildren, aware that there is no link between this nocturnal mammal. The viral infection that has taken a toll of 360 people in China, the country of the deadly virus originated.

The reason for killing is being attributed to social media reports that the coronavirus permeated humans through the bat soup which is widely consumed in China.

The fruit bat, also known as Indian Flying Fox, is one of the largest species of bats found in South Asia. It mainly lives on ripe fruits and is not a carnivorus. The fruit bat is a part of the megabat family. All megabat species are listed as “threatened” by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Some species are listed as “critically endangered”, “endangered”, and “vulnerable”.

Following the killing of the bat, Meerut divisional forest officer Aditi Sharma said, “Although the killing of the bat is an isolated incident, we have to prevent the escalation, particularly in the backdrop of conflicting media reports. It is still to be proved that a bat is responsible for the spread of coronavirus. There is no authenticity in social media reports. So, we will educate masses, especially schoolchildren, not to fall in the trap.”

The coronavirus scare is escalating in the country after three people tested positive in Kerala. The virus has spread to two dozen countries and WHO has also declared the crisis a global health emergency. Soon after the outbreak of the deadly viral disease, reports began emerging connecting it to bat soup, which is quite common in China so much so that a video of a woman consuming the soup also went viral.

Title: Now, Meerut vehicles made before April 2019 can get high security number plates
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Meerut: Nearly a year after new vehicles started coming with high security registration plates, now vehicles made before April 2019, too, will be able to get these plates from their dealers. These number plates have high security features such that they cannot be tampered with or removed as they have a special lock system in place.

The registration plates are made of aluminium and will have unique features with a nine-digit code. This code will help trace any history of challans on this vehicle number.

“Now, vehicles made before April 2019 can get high security number plates too. High security number plates for vehicles made after April 2019 was a mandatory step taken across the country last year. However, earlier there was no mechanism in place to get these number plates for vehicles made before April 2019. But now, vehicle owners can approach their dealers to get these number plates,” said Meerut regional transport officer Vijay Kumar.

Earlier, all the vehicle dealers were instructed to make sure that the new vehicles being purchased should have high security registration plates. These plates are to be provided by the manufacturer of the vehicle to the dealer via the vendor. But now, these number plates can be taken for older vehicles, too, from the dealers concerned.

The registration plate is made of aluminium and will have unique features with a nine-digit code. This code will help trace any history of challans on this vehicle number. It will also have built-in GPS system.

“This step will prevent tampering with number plates as people used to make designs to create a fancy number plate – which cannot be done now. It has a lock of sorts, which if tried to be broken, will also remove the chassis number. It will have a hot stamp chromium based hologram logo and will be printed on a superior grade reflective sheet. While for new vehicles, the price of the plates is included in the cost of the vehicle, but its cost will be taken separately for four-wheelers and two-wheelers which is Rs 334 and Rs 111 respectively,” added Kumar.

Title: Hapur Nagar Palika staffer held while accepting Rs 1 lakh bribe
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Meerut: The anti-corruption body arrested a Nagar Palika staffer red-handed while accepting a bribe of Rs 1 lakh in Hapur’s Pilakhua area on Tuesday. A trap was set after a contractor alleged the accused, Vinod Kumar, was demanding Rs 1 lakh to approve pending bills for 13 projects. A FIR under suitable sections was registered at Hapur Kotwali police station.

The complainant, Madeep Sharma, resident of Modinagar in Ghaziabad, used to work on behalf of his sister Deepa Sharma, who is a registered contractor at Pilakhua’s Nagar Palika. Madeep approached Meerut’s anti-corruption unit with his allegation, following which, a trap was set.

As per plan, the accused Vinod Kumar was called by Madeep to accept the bribe. A team waiting for him arrested Kumar from an overbridge near Pilakhua Mandi, and recovered Rs 1 lakh in cash from him.

In September 2019, CBI had nabbed a superintendent of Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) in Meerut, for demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs 3 lakh from a contractor in Uttar Pradesh power Corporation Limited (UPPCL).

Title: Forest department examines health condition of tuskers
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Thrissur: The forest department expert team on Monday examined the health condition of Guruvayoor Devaswom tuskers, Guruvayoor Padmanabhan and Valiyakesavan .

The team was led by the head of the department of Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University, Dr Syam K Venugopal. The forest department had placed restrictions on Guruvayoor Padmanabhan and Valiyakesavan on December 7 in participating in any functions due to age and health related issues. It was imposed based on the complaint by Kerala state animal welfare board member, M N Jayachandran.

“We inspected the tuskers and will submit the preliminary enquiry report to Thrissur assistant forest conservator within two days,” Dr Venugopal told TOI.

Guruvayoor Devaswom deputy administrator Sasidaran told TOI, “the expert team inspected the tuskers and said that there are no health issues with the elephants. They also said that they will examine Valiyakesavan once again. Our request is that the expert team should take a final decision immediately”.

“Our expert team already inspected the elephants and submitted a report that there were no health issues found in these tuskers,” said the official. Last month, chief wildlife warden Surendrakumar formed a three-member expert committee to inspect the health condition of the tuskers. In his order the warden directed the expert committee to conduct a physical examination of the elephants and clinical examination for the Valiyakesavan by sending samples to tuberculosis lab of Rajeev Gandhi centre for bio-technology. TNN

Title: Day before her wedding, 22-year-old missing woman found dead in Bijnor
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Bijnor: A 22-year-old woman, who went missing on Sunday night, was found dead at Malan River in Bijnor’s Mandawar area on Monday morning.

The missing woman, whose father met with an accident recently and is said to be in a critical condition, was scheduled to get married on Tuesday. The woman’s mother had also passed away a few years ago. While, prima facie, police are claiming it to be a case of suicide, they are also not ruling out any foul play. Police have sent the body to district hospital for postmortem, and have started a probe.

The woman went missing around 11pm on Sunday. Family members and neighbours initially tried to trace her, but failed in their effort. Villagers also launched a search operation on Monday morning.

However, a passer-by spotted her body stuck at one of the pillars of the bridge over Malan River near Rawali village. Malan is a tributary which passes through the deceased’s village. Police, upon receiving information, rushed to the spot. A large number of villagers then gathered and identified the woman.

According to a villager, the woman’s father had sustained injuries two days ago in a road accident when he was on his way to a market to purchase wedding materials for his daughter. He is undergoing treatment now. The woman, who was about to get married to a man of a village under Jalilpur block, was terribly upset after her father’s accident.

Mandawar station house officer, Satendra Kumar, told TOI on Monday, “The woman’s body was found in a river on Monday morning. She was upset for the past few days. Her mother died a few years ago while her father recently suffered severe injuries in a road accident. Her marriage was scheduled on Tuesday. She may have committed suicide. A probe is currently on.”

Title: Motera takes guard for US leader’s trip
Content: Ahmedabad: Large-scale revamping and beautification projects are taking place around the Motera stadium at a hectic pace.US President Donald Trump is likely to inaugurate the stadium or attend an event there later this month. It is believed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will host a political rally for Trump at the stadium, which can hold 110,000 people.In September 2019, Modi had addressed 50,000 people at the ‘Howdy Modi’ event in Houston, Texas. As for the Motera stadium, many roads around it are being resurfaced and pedestrian lanes are being created. More than 1 lakh people may attend the event at the stadium.The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has deployed a number of JET paver machines and conventional road resurfacing is also taking place on many stretches near the stadium.The approach road from Gandhinagar to Motera is being resurfaced and a pedestrian lane is being constructed in area. A railing is being installed under the metro track on the road from Chandkheda Crossroads to the stadium. The land between the railings has been dug up. The contractor carrying out the work said that trees will be planted within a week in this space.Regardless of President Trump’s visit to Motera, the residents are cheering the revamping work as the area had been neglected so far. Viki Bijendra, a resident of Motera, said: “We were all praying that the Indian cricket team plays an international match soon after the stadium is inaugurated.” Bijendra said an event of that nature would have got better roads for the area. “With reports of Trump’s likely visit to the stadium, the attention of the entire AMC is now on the Motera area,” Bijendra said.

Title: Victims of food poisoning stable at KGH
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The condition of four people who fell sick after consuming stale meat and hooch at Logili village in Vizag Agency on Sunday and were admitted to KG Hospital (KGH) in Vizag city is said to be stable. Doctors said they are responding to the treatment.

Superintendent of KGH Dr G Arjuna on Monday visited the Bhavanagar Ward where the four people—Pangi Gasi, Korra Polanna, Korra Kalimani and Pangi Damodar—were undergoing treatment. Dr Arjuna instructed the nephrologist to shift the patients to the nephrology super-specialty block. Dr. Arjuna said that the patients were stable at present.

On Sunday, one person (Pangi Sintro alias Natho) died on the spot and few others fell sick after they allegedly consumed stale meat, toddy and country-made liquor (hooch) during family get-together on the occasion of a local festival.

Inspector of Araku Valley Police Station, P Pydayya said that they are yet to ascertain what led to the food poisoning and are waiting for the reports.

The police handed over the dead body of Sintro to his family members following the post mortem process on Monday.

Title: Special committee formed to prepare revised master plan
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Kozhikode: City corporation authorities have formed a corporation-level special committee headed by mayor Thottathil Raveendran for the preparation of comprehensive Geographic Information System (GIS) based mapping and revised master plan.

The regional town planning and country planning office, Kozhikode , entrusted with the revision of master plan under the national flagship scheme of central government aided Atal Mission for rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (Amrut) scheme.

The revision of the master plan will be carried out only for Kozhikode corporation as city corporation is one among the 500 Amrut cities selected across the country for the execution of the Amrut scheme.

The other members in the special committee include corporation secretary Binu Francis as convener, corporation health standing committee K V Baburaj, town planning standing committee chairman M C Anil Kumar, tax and appeal standing committee chairperson Asha Sasankan, corporation town planner A M Jayan and regional town planner P A Isha and six corporation councillors as members.

The committee is being formed to conduct a sitting to clear the apprehensions, complaints and to clear the doubts of the public once the government publishes the draft of the revised master plan.

The officials of regional town and country planning office Kozhikode, have already held meetings at the wards to collect public opinion and to know their views about the developmental proposals proposed in the revised master plan in their respective wards. The officials also collected suggestions put forth by the public at the time of holding ward-level meeting to incorporate it in the revised master plan.

The revised master plan for Kozhikode city corporation 2019-2039 will provide detailed Geo spatial information on water sources, public utility services, urban land use, income, building footprints, drainage and sewerage network, residential, industrial and hazard-prone areas and sector-wise details.

Regional town planner P A Isha said that the work to prepare a comprehensive revised master plan with GIS mapping is progressing on a war footing. “We are planning to complete the draft of the plan before March 31, 2020,” said the regional town planner.

Title: Panchayat president hacked to death in Erode district
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Representative image

ERODE: A panchayat president was hacked to death by a four-member gang near Andhiyur in Erode district on Monday over previous enmity.

Police have arrested three men and launched a search for the main accused.

Police identified the deceased as S Radhakrishnan alias Chinna Thangam , of Unjakkadu Thottam near Velli Tirupur in Andhiyur taluk.

He was the panchayat president of Sankarapalayam panchayat.

A total of eight cases including a murder case were pending against him at the Velli Tirupur police station, a police officer said.

“While Radhakrishnan was talking with a few people on Andhiyur-Burgur Road, a Scarpio stopped near him and four people got out it. They started hacking him using sickles. After ensuring that the victim had died, the gang fled from the spot,” Erode SP Sakthi Ganesh said.

After people alerted the Velli Tirupur police, they reached the spot and initiated an inquiry. They also alerted other police stations in the region.

Based on the information, police began checking vehicles in key roads. At Dharmaapuri bus stand, when Kavindapadi police stopped a SUV, a group of four people tried to escape from them. But police personnel arrested three, while one managed to escape.

The arrested were Saravanan, 26, Balamurugan , 26 and Rajesh, 24, while Siva, 26, escaped, the SP said.

“While questioning, they confessed that they were hired by S Aravind, 30, of Sankarampalayam to kill Radhakrishnan,” the SP said, adding, “A murder case against Radhakrishnan for killing Aravind’s father in 2013 has been pending with the Erode district court.”

Based on the confession, the police registered a case. The arrested were lodged at the Coimbatore central prison in judicial custody.

Police have launched a search for Aravind.

Title: Agency’s ganja cultivators getting external support?
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Officials of the prohibition and excise department are investigating links between ganja cultivators from Idukki district in Kerala and tribals in Vizag Agency upon receiving credible information that smugglers from the Agency have recruited cultivators from Idukki.

Speaking to TOI, deputy excise commissioner T Srinivasa Rao said some persons from the Idukki valley, supported by local tribal farmers, had set up ganja plantations in the hinterlands of the Agency and along the Andhra Odisha Border (AOB) and were making profits. “We are collecting information from various sources to establish links between persons from Kerala and Agency area tribals involved in cultivating ganja in remote areas,” Srinivasa Rao said.

Police sources said ganja cultivators from Kerala have also taken land on lease from tribal farmers. Along with ganja, cultivators are also extracting hashish oil, the demand for which has been growing among users.

“We have nabbed over 50 inter-state ganja smugglers, including some persons from Kerala, in Vizag city in the past few years. Our investigation ends with the arrest of the smugglers but there is a need to investigate further into the trade to identify the big sharks,” said ACP (task force) A Trinad Rao. “Some ganja smugglers are also trying to introduce hashish oil, which will bring them huge profits,” Rao added.

Police and excise officials said there is a high demand for cannabis cultivated in Vizag with prices for one kilogram ranging between Rs 30,000 to Rs 50,000 in Bengaluru, New Delhi, Mumbai and other metros. The cannabis grown in the Agency tracts is of superior quality and second only to Idukki Gold, the strain that originates in Idukki. Once a hub of ganja cultivation, cultivators from Idukki district are now setting up plantations in the Agency and along the AOB after enforcement agencies in Kerala came down on cultivators.

For inter-state smugglers from Kerala and even Tamil Nadu and a few Agency farmers though, ganja cultivation has emerged as a major source of income.

“It is difficult to root out ganja cultivation in tribal pockets in Vizag Agency as the inter-state smugglers are investing in plantations and hiring out experts and getting good returns,” said B Lokanadham, district secretary of the Communist Party of India (Marxist).

Title: BJP scuttled my Ahmedabad University position, Ramchandra Guha tweets
Content:
Ramchandra Guha

AHMEDABAD: Noted historian Ramchandra Guha mounted a scathing attack on the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday alleging that the party had scuttled his chances of joining a university in Ahmedabad as a professor for Gandhian studies. Guha took to the social media platform, Twitter, to vent his grievance. The tweet carried a link to a video of his public lecture on Gandhi and his legacy, delivered in Ahmedabad last Thursday.“In October 2018, the ruling party made it impossible for me to take up a professorship in Gandhian studies in Ahmedabad. On January 30, 2020, I was able to visit the city to speak on Gandhi and his legacy,” mentioned the tweet posted by Guha on Monday at 2.28pm. This is the first time after a year and a half of the controversy that Guha came out in public citing clear reasons of his not joining the university.When the issue came to light, the then office bearers of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), a student body attached to the BJP, had told TOI that they had “made a representation before the varsity officials to desist from any association with people who are anti-national.”When contacted, AU vice chancellor, Pankaj Chandra , refused to comment on the matter.

Title: 19 suspects screened for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh
Content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: Nineteen people with travel history to China have been screened for Novel coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh informed senior health department officials here on Monday.In a press release, MP health department has directed for screening of all visitors who have visited coronavirus-affected countries in the recent past. No positive case of novel coronavirus case has been reported from the state, till now.So far, 13 samples of MP patients suspected of the deadly virus has been sent to NIV Pune. Another six patients are quarantined after their return to India. Two are Chinese nationals working in a project in Mandsaur while two are from Khargone and one is from Mandideep.“Overall around 19 people have been screened with symptoms of Novel Coronavirus. Around seven or eight test reports of suspected patients are awaited from NIV Pune,” said a health department official. Six people whose samples were sent to national institute of virology (NIV) Pune tested negative for the deadly contagion that has killed over 300 people and infected over 14,000 globally.Meanwhile, in Bhopal , health minister Tulsi Silawat chaired a meeting of health department officials and reviewed the situation. He directed the officials to make sure that there is no panic and government hospitals have the facilities to meet the challenge. It was decided that tourists and visitors from affected countries would be screened for the virus and kept in observation till blood report is received.

Title: Pleasant weather, V-day queries extend water fest till Feb 16
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Indore: The Jal Mahotsav at Hanuwantiya backwaters has been extended till February 16 amid conducive weather and fresh enquiries ahead of the approaching Valentine’s Day.

The month-long Jal Mahotsav was scheduled to conclude on February 3 but the state tourism department and event organisers announced to extend the event for over 10 days.

Hiteshwar Singh, a partner at the event organising company hosting Jal Mahotsav said, “Looking at the weather condition and enquires for coming weekends, the date was extended. We are hoping for some encouraging footfall in these dates though water activities will continue throughout the year.”

MP tourism department in November 2019 had leased out the land at Hanuwantiya backwaters to an event management company for five years. As per the contract, the tourism department gave them land and fixed infrastructure to host the Jal Mahotsav for another four years.

Officials and organising team were anticipating the footfall to remain around 3.5 lakh tourists this year during the month but the event fetched lukewarm response amid lack of promotional activities.

An official from the state tourism department wishing anonymity said, “The footfall was not as we anticipated, mainly because people were not aware of the event and attractions at this place. We plan to do extensive promotion for next year’s event so that we get a better response from people.”

Lack of proper road connectivity and infrastructure gaps also led to poor tourist response and bookings at the tent city that has 104 tents in different categories spread across five acres, said sources.

The organisers plan to host Jal Mahotsav every year at the backwaters while water sports and adventure activities will run throughout the year.

Singh said, “From now onwards, we plan to host Jal Mahotsav every year and next Mahotsav will start in mid-December. The tent city will be there for two to three months of which one month will be celebrated as Jal Mahotsav.”

Title: CM offers special puja at Vaarshik Mahotsav
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy with Vishaka Sri Sarada Peetham’s head Swami Swaroopanandendra at its Vaarshik Mahotsav... Read More

Visakhapatnam: Special prayers were offered by Chief Minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy at the Sarada Peetham on Monday. The chief minister along with TTD chairman, Y V Subba Reddy, performed Srinivasa Chaturveda Havanam, which was sponsored by the TTD.

Earlier in the day, the TTD chairman along with other YSRC leaders welcomed the chief minister at the airport after which he headed straight to the ashram, where special annual celebrations were being held. The cheif minister also performed go-puja and jammi-chettu puja. Sarada Peetham pontiff, Swami Swaroopanandendra was present throughout the occasion.

Following the pujas, Jaganmohan Reddy unveiled a plaque at the ashram premises in Chinnamushirvada and participated in the Rajya Syamala Yagam. He also felicitated vedic pandit, Sriman Tangirala Viswanadha Sastry, of Kaplieswaram in East-Godavari district.

Other VVIPs who attended the programme and conducted special pujas at the Peetham were Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy, Telangana minister of animal husbandary, fisheries and cinematography Talasani Srinivas Yadav, senior YSRC leader V Vijayasai Reddy and state minister for agriculture Kurasala Kannababu.

Meanwhile, members of the CPI (M) tried to block the CM’s convoy, when it was on its way to the Peetham, and many of the local CPI(M) functionaries along with their cadre were taken into custody by the Pendurthi police. The blockade was conducted in protest against the land pooling underway in the district.

Title: Relief in Indore after two suspects test negative for coronavirus
Content:
Representative image

INDORE: Of the three samples, which were sent sent to National Institute of Virology (NIV) Pune for detection of coronavirus from Indore division, two tested negative on Monday, while result of one suspect is awaited.The two suspects- 21-year-old boy from Khargone district and 22-year-old girl from Indore district - were admitted in MY Hospital on Friday after they developed cold-like symptoms. The duo was pursuing their studies in medicine in cities of China. They had returned India on January 15 following spread of coronavirus in China.“Pune-based National Institute of Virology has tested blood and swab samples of two students as negative. We have received reports on Monday that the patients, who were admitted in an isolation ward, were not found infected with coronavirus,” MYH superintendent Dr P S Thakur said.The students were discharged from the hospital on Monday evening. Lab reports of another suspected coronavirus case is awaited, Dr Thakur said.Two more persons have approached health department after returning from China. “Two more persons have approached us after returning from China. Both of them have no cold-like symptoms, but as a precautionary measure we have put them on home isolation to monitor their health condition,” CMHO (working) Dr Purnima Gadariya said.Dr Gadariya said that they had received a guideline from state government with instructions to put people, who have returned from China and 20 other nearby countries after January 25, on home isolation. Field workers have been roped in for survey and screening of such cases. “On witnessing any symptom of coronavirus, samples of the patient will be sent for lab test. Besides, the patient will be provided N-95 masks and his/her family will be given three-layer masks,” she said.“There is nothing to panic. We are just following the protocol. We have issued instructions to keep a close watch on suspected cases,” divisional commissioner Akash Tripathi said.Appropriate arrangements have also been made at Indore airport for screening of suspected passengers coming from Dubai to Indore.

Title: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot to dedicate Unesco Heritage Certificate to Jaipur’s people
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot will dedicate the Unesco Heritage Certificate to the people of Jaipur in the presence of the UN body’s director general Audrey Azoulay , who will be here on Wednesday.

Azoulay’s visit is believed to be important after Unesco inscribed Jaipur as World Heritage Site last year and signed an agreement with the tourism department to promote the intangible heritage of Western Rajasthan .

During the dedication ceremony, the chief minister will also felicitate her in the presence of tourism minister Vishvendra Singh, minister of local self government Shanti Kumar Dhariwal and minister for art and culture B D Kalla.

State tourism director Bhanwar Lal said a brochure on ‘Intangible Heritage Promotion Project’ will also be released on the occasion.

“The project aims at developing 10 new cultural tourism destinations in the state, whereby tourists will extend their stays by at least one extra day. The four districts in Western Rajasthan which will benefit from this project are Jodhpur , Barmer , Jaisalmer and Bikaner. It will directly impact 1,500 artistes. The three-year project implementation cost will be to the tune of Rs 7.50 crore,” added Bhanwar Lal.

Capacity building, preservation and promotion of handicraft , embroidery artists, Langa and Manganiyar musicians, Kalbelia artistes , pottery and terracotta artists have been identified as the key objectives of Unesco’s association with the state tourism department.

Title: BBMP to seek relaxation of animal birth control norms
Content:
AWBI rules mandate the programme be conducted only by non-governmental organisations or animal welfare bodies.... Read More

NGOs unhappy with tender components

More ABC centres

BENGALURU: With the stray dog population increasing rapidly, BBMP is set to write to Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) seeking relaxation in animal birth control (ABC) programme norms as it’s unable to get agencies on board to neuter canines under the prevailing regime.As per the latest stray dog census figures released last December, around 1.4 lakh canines have to neutered. This figure is 46% of the estimated stray dog population in the city.AWBI rules mandate the programme be conducted only by non-governmental organisations or animal welfare bodies.However, the civic agency’s expression of interest (EOI) notifications have been getting poor response from not-for-profits.For example, in Bommanahalli and east zones, the Palike floated a tender thrice in the past few months but no one has come forward to catch, sterilise and immunise stray dogs. A senior BBMP official said: “We will urge AWBI to allow us to make use of veterinarians’ services to conduct the ABC programme,” he added.Animal welfare NGOs, on the other hand, say they’re not happy with components of the tender floated by BBMP. “It has fixed Rs 1,200 for neutering a dog and Rs 150 per dog for administering anti-rabies vaccination. While the cost factor is manageable, there aren’t many shelters in the city to conduct the operations. On the other hand, shelters owned by NGOs can conduct only a limited number of operations per day. Nobody wants to take the risk,” said Pranamya K, an animal activist.BBMP officials say they have plans to increase the number of ABC centres where neutering operations are done and dogs are kept under observation before being released on their home turfs. “Currently, we have only one ABC centre per zone. Given that the latest census figures put the dog population at 3 lakh, we need at least three-four centres per zone or one per assembly constituency. We are working to set up more units,” said an official.Goa-based Worldwide Veterinary Service Centre (WVSC) conducted the census in December. The last such exercise was conducted seven years ago.

Title: 22-yr-old kills another in Kichha, surrenders before court
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Nainital: A 22-year-old man, identified as Sooraj, killed another man in broad daylight on Monday in Kichha area of US Nagar district.

Police said that the deceased, identified as Vikas Kumar, 25, was a resident of Kichha and was going out to get some medicine when Sooraj approached and attacked him with a knife. “The incident took place in the morning and eyewitnesses said that Sooraj attacked Kumar with a knife that he was carrying. We were informed by locals, however, within a few minutes, Sooraj came to the police station and surrendered,” said US Nagar, ASP, Devendra Pincha.

Sources said that Sooraj killed Kumar because of family animosity. Pincha added that Sooraj has been taken into custody and an FIR has also been registered under section 302 of IPC.

Title: Bofors guns to Sukhoi jets, def might on display
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Lucknow: The ground in Vrindavan Yojna on Sultanpur Road turned into a ‘battle zone’ on Monday, when scores of combat tanks and armed personnel in their war gears enacted an operation to capture the enemy post.

As armed men moved forward amid ‘explosions’, artillery and battle tanks resorted to ‘heavy shelling’ to push the enemy back. From the gigantic Russian battle tank like T-90 (Bhishma) to indigenous Arjun battle tank and Bofors guns, all worked as per the plan laid out for the operation.

Initially, passerbys who stopped to see the action did not realise what was happening. However, they soon realised that it was a rehearsal for a show to be staged during the Defence Expo. The dust raising explosions and smoke was artificially generated to make enactment appear like a real battleground.

While the infantry took the charge on the ground, fighter jets including Sukhoi and Jaguar flown by Indian Air Force’s Surya Kiran team left people spellbound with their beautiful formations and by painting tri-colour in the sky with smoke.

Later at Gomti riverfront, naval commandos demonstrated ‘Marcos Action’, an offensive to neutralise terrorists.

Marine Commando Force or Marcos is a special operation force of the Indian Navy meant for hostage rescue and counter-terrorism operations, among other things.

The action began with light combat helicopters taking a position in the air and ropes dropping down from a great height with the naval commandos sliding down with lightning speed on the sailboat and shooting terrorists before climbing back again. The action-packed show was followed by a rehearsal of a patriotic music performance by the naval band. Models of army bunkers are also being constructed at the venue to enable people to understand the harsh conditions army personnel face in borders.

Title: Labourer gets 10 years in jail for raping 14-year-old
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Vadodara: A sessions court here sentenced a casual labourer to rigorous imprisonment for raping and minor girl from Shinor after luring her with marriage promise in August 2014.

The convict Babu alias Bharat Vasava was also fined of Rs 11,000 by the court of additional sessions judge S D Suthar.

According to the details of the case, Vasava had met the 14-year-old girl at a fair in Shinor and lured her with marriage promise. When the girl did not return home from the fair, her family members searched for her. Later, the girl’s father learned through a villager that he had seen Vasava taking her away from the fair. The girl’s father then approached Shinor police station and a search was initiated for the duo. A few weeks later they were found from Rajkot and the girl’s medical check-up confirmed rape. In her statement too she said that Vasava had raped her several times at different places.

“During the trial, several evidence including forensic reports, medical reports and testimonies of witnesses and material witnesses were presented,” said additional public prosecutor K M Joshi. While convicting Vasava, the court awarded a compensation of Rs 25,000 to the rape survivor under the rehabilitation scheme of the state government.

Title: Constable’s widow to get her dues after a 3-decade-long fight
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Pithoragarh: After years of making rounds of several departments, 60-year-old Nanda Devi, wife of a constable who was slain while on duty in the early 1980s, will finally get her due. Her husband Surendra Singh, posted in 31 PAC Batallion at Rudrapur, was killed in an encounter with dacoits on February 8, 1982, in Bikhona village of Agra.

Till 2011, Devi was given just Rs 458 which was her husband’s pay in 1982. And after 2011, when the service tenure of her husband got completed, she got a family pension amount which was fixed in 1982. “The pay was revised several times since 1982 but I never got the correct amount,” said Nanda Devi, who lives in Lelu village of Pithoragarh. In 2018, she approached DS Bhandari, an RTI activist, and asked for his help. “The pay was revised in 1986, 1996, 2006, and 2016, but Nanda Devi did not get the benefit. So, I first wrote to Allahabad police headquarters but didn’t receive any response. Later in June 2019, I wrote to State Information Commission. Taking cognisance of the matter, the body issued relevant instructions and now Nanda Devi will receive the right family pension amount,” Bhandari told TOI. He added that the order for revised pension has reached Pithoragarh’s district treasury office from Auditor General office in Dehradun. “The pending amount is nearly Rs 10 lakh and we hope that Nanda Devi gets it soon,” Bhandari said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: After security breach at airport, five SAF personnel suspended
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Accused in Bhopal police custody

BHOPAL: A day after a youth breached the Raja Bhoj airport security and vandalized a chopper at the state hangar and blocked a plane, heads have started rolling. Five SAF personnel who were deployed at state hangar have been suspended for negligence. Beides, Gandhi Nagar SHO SI Tarun Bhati has been removed and attached to DIG office. DIG Irshad Wali said security arrangement at the state hangar is being assessed.

Meanwhile at a review meeting of the different agencies with the district administration it has been decided to internally segregate the state hangar from the airport. The state hangar and airport are in the same compound, without a fence separating the two. Government aircraft and chartered planes use the hangar. Surprisingly, CCTVs were found missing at the state hangar. A high-level meeting of airport authorities, CISF and state police was held to assess the airport’s security arrangements.

“For security enhancement a proposal will be submitted in the near future. All necessary arrangement including CCTV, enhancement of manpower and other pertaining things will be done within a week,” said Wali. Meanwhile, crime branch took the statement of accused Yogesh’s father Vishwa Mohan Tripathi. Police also spoke to his neighbours to know about the metal status of the accused.

In a major security breach at Raja Bhoj airport, a 22-year-old college student — who allegedly wanted to play commando — sneaked into the state hangar on Sunday evening, vandalized a parked helicopter and blocked a SpiceJet flight that was moving for takeoff. DIG (CISF), Neelam, also reached the Bhopal airport.

Deputy commandant, CISF Virender Singh, confirmed to TOI that the state hangar will be segregated from Raja Bhoj airport. “We have spoken with the state police. It has been decided to segregate the state hangar from the main airport.” Asked as to how it will be segregated, Singh said, “It will be done by putting up a wall, mounted by wire. We will send the proposal to the higher authorities soon.”

He added that at present, there is no frisking arrangement at the state hangar. “It is also decided to put body scanner, CCTVs and other security arrangement at the state hangar,” said Singh.

About the manpower deployment, Singh said CISF deployment will be increased. “At present, there are 179 personnel deployed at the airport. There is need of another 115 for which a demand has been made,” said Singh.

Justifying the need for more CISF jawans, Singh said, “After the state hangar is separated, more CISF personnel will be required to secure the airport. The new air cargo terminal is also coming up near the state hangar. In such a situation, there is a need for more manpower.”

Airport director, Anil Vikram, said a high-level meeting was organised where airport security authorities discussed several issues. “I can’t tell you much due to security reasons. However, only thing I can tell you is that there was a high-level meeting,” said director Vikram.

After the incident, CISF personnel arrested the suspect, Yogesh Tripathi, who sports a crew cut and goatee and wore camouflage trousers. Yogesh told security personnel that he breached airport security because he “wanted to get into commando training”. His family is bewildered by this claim and says he had never shown any inclination for military service. The accused entered the state hangar through the gate before committing the crime.

Title: Ashok Gehlot slams finance minister for not disclosing job figures
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Monday said Union finance minister Nirmala Sitaraman kept mum on the number of jobs created as there was not much to talk about.

Sitaraman while presenting the budget had not quoted any figure on job creation saying Congress leader Rahul Gandhi would dispute the figure.

Gehlot in a tweet said, “The FM should not be scared of #RahulGandhi ji’s questions. Instead she should reveal figures of new jobs to be created, which youth are waiting to hear. But she has no answers as generating employment is not in govt’s priority. No jobs, no figures, therefore no answers from the FM.”

Rahul Gandhi had launched an campaign against the ruling party for letting down the youth on the job front kicking off a ‘Yuva Aakrosh’ rally from Jaipur on January 28. Similar rallies are planned in other cities as the opposition Congress plans to cash in on the disenchantment of the youth with the Modi government.

CM condemns Hedge

The chief minister also took on BJP southern siren Anant kumar Hegde MP calling Gandhi's freedom struggle a ‘drama’.

The chief minister in a tweet said, “The BJP MP’s statement is condemnable. BJP leaders can afford to call freedom movement a drama only because they nvr fought for India’s independence & nvr made any sacrifices. Such statements reveal their true mindset that they use Gandhiji’s name just for show & hv no regard for him.”

Hegde, a former Union minister, reportedly claimed at an event in Bangalore that the entire freedom movement was staged with the consent and support of the British, and the independence movement led by Gandhi was a "drama".

BJP had sought an apology from the MP for his unsavory comment on the Father of the Nation and the freedom movement.

Title: A glimpse of Mithilanchal at cultural extravaganza in city
Content: Ahmedabad: Maithils love to say, “Desil Bayana Sab Jan Mittha (Everyone considers his or her language as the sweetest). Drawn together by the sweetness of their language, spoken mostly in north Bihar and southeastern Nepal, Maithili-speaking people living in Gujarat and from other parts of the country converged at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Memorial Hall at Shahibaug in Ahmedabad on Sunday to celebrate Mithila Vibhuti Smriti Mahotsav.The Mahotsav started at 2:30pm, and soon the venue turned into a mini-Mithila with people clad in their traditional attire — men in dhoti-kurta, paag, dopta and women in colourful sari — actively taking part in the events organized by the Maa Janki Sewa Samiti and the Shashwat Mithila Foundation.Speaking on the occasion, chief guests J N Singh, former chief secretary; Shivanand Jha, DGP Gujarat; Mohan Jha, retired IPS officer; Manoj Kumar Das, principal secretary to the CM; Brajesh Kumar Jha, home secretary; Samir Tekriwal (IRS), Anil Chaudhary (ITS), and other dignitaries highlighted the glorious history of Mithila and the unfathomable zeal of people from Mithilanchal to excel in every field, be it literary, administrative or social work.The cultural programmes presented on the occasion by noted artists Ranjana Jha, Pandit Kunj Bihari Mishra, Abhdhutanandji and Meenakshi Thakur drew huge applause from the people, who enjoyed every moment of the cultural extravaganza with their kids and acquaintances.Many prominent personalities who have excelled in different fields were honoured with the Mithila Shiromani Award. Quiz winners Jyoti and Jaya Chaudhary. were given colour TVs.

Title: CID headquarters may shift to engg college in Kommadi
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The headquarters of the Crime Investigation Department ( CID ) are likely to shift soon to the outskirts of the Port City.

Senior officials at the department have given the go-ahead for the shift from AP police headquarters in Mangalagiri to Chaitanya Engineering College in Kommadi in Vizag city. A DIG-rank officer CM Trivikram Varma visited the city on a three-day tour to narrow down on a suitable space to house CID headquarters.

At present, the headquarters occupy two of four floors at police headquarters in Mangalagiri, comprising a space of 40,000 square feet. The administrative building of the engineering college has a space of 60,000 square feet.

“All officers and ministerial staff will be accommodated in this administrative building once the government releases the GO. We will accommodate two cyber laboratories in the same, which are now located outside the office in Mangalagiri,” said a senior IPS officer at the CID on condition of anonymity. The Disha office would also be accommodated in the same structure, the officer added.

The CID, which has seven regional offices in the state, is headed by additional director general PV Sunil Kumar and has two DIGs, 10 SP-rank officers, three additional SPs and other staff including over 25 DSPs, around 80 inspectors, more than 100 sub-inspectors and another 200 staff.

Given the strength of its cadre, the CID will have an ADG-rank officer as head, two IG-rank and three DIG-rank officers to supervise cybercrimes, financial fraud, human rights violations, a women protection cell and counterfeit currency cases. The CID is also responsible for crime analysis and planning and implementation of criminal intelligence.

Title: ‘Will shoot Clock Tower protesters’
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

LUCKNOW: A civil engineer who threatened to shoot protesters at the ongoing anti-CAA agitation at the Husainabad Clock Tower was arrested from Thakurganj area of Lucknow on Monday.

The accused Shravan Sharma (24), a resident of Thakurganj, works with a private firm in Chinhat.

In a Facebook post on January 30, Shravan had threatened to shoot the protesters at the Clock Tower and even claimed that he had bought a pistol for the purpose.

Police said Shravan Sharma, a native of Unnao, completed a diploma course in civil engineering from a private institute in Sitapur.

SHO Thakurganj Pramod Kumar Mishra said Shravan went to friend’s home in Thakurganj from where he was arrested. He has been booked under the charges of creating hatred between two communities, and provoking breach of peace, SHO added.

Additional deputy commissioner of police, west zone, Vikas Chandra Tripathi said police are probing whether Sharvan had been influenced by some radical group.

Shravan told the police that he was coaxed by some friends to post the inflammatory message on his Facebook page.

On January 31, a youth had shot at a Jamia Millia Islamia student during an anti-CAA protest.

Title: CAA aimed to divert attention from inflation, unemployment: Harish Rawat
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Dehradun: Former CM Harish Rawat on Monday extended support to residents who are opposing CAA , NRC. On the occasion, he launched a scathing attack on the ruling party saying that the move was aimed to create a divide among people and divert their attentions from simmering issues like inflation, unemployment and other failures.

Rawat said, “The freedom fighters and our seniors had made it clear that no one will be discriminated in the country on lines of caste, creed or religion. This was not a decision of the Congress but all those personalities who led the freedom struggle. Now in this BJP government a new theory has cropped up, where people are being discriminated on basis of their religion.”

Congress state chief Pritam Singh is scheduled to visit the Parade ground on Tuesday to express his support.

Title: Cancer cases in Ahmedabad up 60% in 10 years
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Between 2007 and 2016, there was a 60% increase in the number of cancer cases recorded in the ‘Ahmedabad Urban Agglomeration Area,’ states Population-Based Cancer Registry (PBCR) data, an annual increase of about 4.8%. The data since 2017 has not been made public. The registry is maintained by the National Centre for Disease Informatics and Research, ICMR, Bengaluru.The data found that the prevalance rate of cancer has gone down, from 98.6 per lakh among males and 81.2 in females in 2007, the figures were 94.3 and 77 for 2016, respectively.Dr Shashank Pandya, director of Gujarat Cancer Research Institute (GCRI), said the overall increase can be attributed to two factors. “Over the past decade, population of the city has increased and that will surely reflect on the numbers. There is also an increase in awareness, we see more patients today at stages I and II, which was not the case a few years ago,” he said.GCRI at Civil Hospital, the biggest cancer hospital in Gujarat, attends to about 83 new cases a day, or 2,500 cases a month, that may or may not need hospitalization. Officials said that health insurance — both government and private — has improved cancer reporting in recent years.Experts point to the state’s notorious tobacco consumption habit as the major cause and which can be easily prevented. Dr Somesh Chandra, a city-based oncosurgeon, said the youngest person with tobacco-related cancer he has seen was 18 years old. “Having gutka/masala is found to be causing cancer much faster than other forms of tobacco consumption. It is severely affecting adolescents and young adults (YAY) in Gujarat,” he said, adding that such cancers are more aggressive.Dr Parimal Jivrajani, preventive oncologist, said regular screening of tobacco chewers and smokers by experts and general practitioners or even by themselves can detect cancer at early stages. “Hidden cases in almost all categories of cancer cannot be ruled out,” he said.

Title: 3 grandsons arrested for murdering grandfather
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Nashik: The Satpur police arrested three grandsons for allegedly murdering their 65-year-old grandfather, who was found dumped in a water channel along Wasali road on Friday night.

The three suspects were arrested on Sunday and remanded to police custody till February 7.

Senior police inspector of the Satpur police station Rakesh Hande said that the trio was arrested on the suspicion of murdering their grandfather Ramdas Gopala Khoskar, a resident of Naikwade village near Girnare.

The murdered victim used to work as a labourer was addicted to alcohol and used to abuse his grandsons over petty issues which resulted in they killing him. Hande said that the details of the murder are yet to be known as they are investigating the case.

During the investigation, it was found that Khoskar was struck on the head with a blunt object. He had left his house on Wednesday and did not return home since then. His family members lodged a missing complaint.

The police were suspicious of why the family members of the victim did not lodge a missing complaint even after Khoskar failed to come home after two days. Further, there was also no attempt by any family members to trace the elderly person which forced the cops to focus on the three grandsons, who were subsequently arrested.

Hande said that things would be clear during the custodial interrogation of the suspects. Khoskar is also a distant relative of Igatpuri MLA Hiraman Khoskar.

Title: Ex-Jaipur collector asked to deposit Rs 7.4 lakh paid in excess
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Jagroop Singh

JAIPUR: The department of personnel has asked former Jaipur collector Jagroop Singh to pay Rs 7.4 lakh, which it claims was paid to him due to wrong grade increment when he was promoted to super time scale in 2010 while he was an RAS officer. Yadav was later promoted to the IAS cadre from state service.

The department said either he should authorise the DoP to deduct the amount from his gratuity or deposit the amount so that his pension papers could be processed.

Singh told TOI that the department claimed that he was paid two grade increments on promotion from 2010 to 2012 which was a mistake and has now come to its notice while preparing the pension. According to the calculation by the DoP, the total amount comes out to around Rs 7.4 lakh.

Singh said the DoP had fixed his pay in 2012, 2015 and 2018 but it did not come to their notice. “Now they are claiming that I have to pay the amount or it will be deducted from my gratuity. I do not have this much of money in my bank account. I have authorized them to do whatever is they want,” he added.

He said, “I had paid income tax at 34% to the amount they claim to have paid in excess. The mistake was not committed on my part but by the DoP. At least they should return the the tax that I paid because of my excess salary,” said Singh.

Title: Tamil Nadu, Puducherry NCC cadets bag four gold medals at Republic Day parade in Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

PUDUCHERRY: The NCC cadets of Tamil Nadu , Puducherry and Andaman & Nicobar Islands (TN, P & AN) directorate won four gold medals at the Republic Day parade camp at New Delhi. The directorate has secured the third position overall in the all-India basis.

Seventeen directorates in the country participated in the parade camp.

Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi hosted a reception at her official residence Raj Nivas on Monday morning to felicitate 111 cadets of TN, P & AN directorate for their impressive performance at the Republic day parade camp.

TN, P & AN directorate cadets bagged gold medals in individual events such as best cadet - army, navy and air wing. The directorate was also declared as the winner of All India Nau Sainik Camp.

Speaking on the occasion Bedi said NCC is an investment to build the nation. NCC creates leadership qualities and leads the cadets to succeed in life. Without hard work, one cannot be selected to wear the uniform. It requires extra stamina, she said.

Bedi recalled that she was wearing three uniforms during school days, one for school, other for sports and another for NCC. She appealed to the cadets to volunteer their services to the weekend morning rounds to transform Puducherry into a clean and green town and make the town water-rich. Puducherry group headquarters group commander Jayachandran and others participated in the felicitation function.

Title: Lucknow: Phones recovered, question on robbery angle to murder
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Cops examine the crime site

Lucknow: Investigations into the murder of Hindutva leader Ranjeet Bachchan , who was shot dead near Globe park in the heart of the state capital on Sunday morning, made a headway on Monday when police recovered the two cellphones reportedly robbed from Bachchan and his cousin Aditya Srivastava by the assailant before he opened fire at them from point-blank range.

The phones were recovered about three kilometres from the crime spot. Bachchan died on the spot after being shot in the face, while Aditya, who suffered a gunshot wound in his left arm, had told police that the assailant first robbed them of cellphones and then opened fire. The recovery of phones ruled out any mobile snatching angle to the murder, said sources privy to the probe.

Additional deputy commissioner, central zone, Chiranjeevi Nath Singh told TOI, “The mobile phones belonging to the slain Hindutva leader and his cousin were recovered near Bhaisakund under Hazratganj police station area. Both the phones have been given to experts for retrieving data and chats while the footage of CCTVs installed on the route from the crime spot are being scanned.”

Police also questioned some relatives and contacts of the slain leader who revealed that he used to take money from people in the name of constructing an old age home in Patarka Tola area in Gulharia Bazaar police station area of Gorakhpur and assisting them in getting job. The probe team is in touch with Gorakhpur police and seeking details about Bachchan’s close acquaintances.

Police said Bachchan, who was associated with Samajwadi Party and had formed his own party — Vishwa Hindu Mahasabha — in 2017, was also into theatre and had been a graded artist of Doordarshan.

The investigators also found that one Shubham who used to accompany Ranjeet on morning walk daily did not go with him on Sunday.

Meanwhile, a source privy to the probe said police and STF have closed in on the accused. Police have checked over 100 CCTV footages and scanned over 200 phone numbers. Meanwhile, joint commissioner of police Nilabja Choudhary has been named head of the investigation team probing the murder case.

Title: Dwarka jn becomes congestion free, finally
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Nashik: The bumper-to-bumper traffic at Dwaka junction became a thing of the past on Monday as slew of measures taken by the city police seemed to do wonder.

As many as 40 police personnel were deployed at the junction from the morning till 10pm to take care of every problem that hindered smooth flow of traffic.

“Smooth flow of traffic at Dwarka junction could be obtained after barring all heavy vehicles and private buses at the entry points near KK Wagh College, Dwarka Circle, Indiranagar underpass, Splendour Hall and Garvare T Point,” a police officer said.

Similarly, heavy vehicles and private buses to and from Pune, Sangamner and Sinnar were banned from using the Dwarka junction and were diverted via Fame Signal-Ramdas Swami route-Jejurkar Mala-Mirchi Hotel signal-Aurangabad Road-Amrutdham Chowk route to move towards the Dhule side or elsewhere.

Heavy vehicles to and from Mumbai side were diverted on the Fame Signal-Sri Sri Ravishankar Road-Wadala Pathardi Road-Pathardi village circle-Pathardi Phata route. Apart from this, the police had also moved all autorickshaw and taxi stands around 100 metre away from the junction.

Meanwhile, many commuters expressed satisfaction over the traffic diversion. Pravin Ahire, a farmer from Nashik Road, said, “Police have done an excellent job to do away with the perennial problem of traffic congestion at Dwarka circle. For the past many years traffic issues of Dwarka could not be solved. However, this time around police have managed to succeed.”

Amit Pawar, a resident of Adgaon, said, “Every day while coming from Adgaon I used to spend at least 15 minutes in the traffic jam at Dwarka. On Monday, however, I crossed the junction in less than a minute.”

Commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil said, “We monitored things minutely over three days observing the problem. From the observation I found out that heavy goods vehicles which had no work at the junction were using it when there are alternative roads. Many private passenger buses also halted near the junction adding to the problem.”

He added, “Encroachments on the road were also cleared to open up the free lefts of the junction. This all created a breathing space at the junction, resulting into a smoother flow of traffic. 90% of the traffic problem at Dwarka has been mitigated.”

Title: 1.6kg of gold seized at airport last week
Content: Ahmedabad: In three separate seizures of smuggled gold were made at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International (SVPI) airport in Ahmedabad last week, and a cumulative 1.6kg of gold was seized by Ahmedabad Customs officials. Three Indian passengers, coming from Bangkok and Sharjah, were arrested in these incidents.On Wednesday, a passenger of Indian origin arrived at the city airport from Bangkok, and was caught with 729g of 24-carat gold in paste form, hidden in three capsules in his rectum.The seized gold was valued at Rs 33.06 lakh.Another passenger who arrived from Bangkok on Friday was found to have 298.7g of gold, concealed in one capsule in his rectum.The third passenger nabbed by Ahmedabad Customs was held on the basis on at-the-spot intelligence on Thursday.He had concealed 600g of gold in his jacket, in the form of a gold bracelet, chain and an anklet. These items were valued at Rs 25 lakh.Ahmedabad Customs registered 113 cases of gold smuggling between April 1, 2019 and January 31, 2020, and seized 77kg gold worth Rs 27.11 crore at the Ahmedabad and Surat airports.The majority of apprehended passengers had arrived from Dubai, Sharjah, Oman, Kuwait and Bangkok, according to top officials.

Title: Reducing revenue deficit a task, as AP’s tax share dips
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Vijayawada: With the 15th Financial Commission using 2011 population figures instead of the 1971 census for tax devolution, Andhra Pradesh’s tax share has come down from 4.3% to 4.1%.

This would be a dampener for the state government ’s efforts to reduce its revenue deficit.

The latest commission has been at the centre of a controversy after many southern states opposed the terms of reference which would have disincentivised the successful population control measures taken by them over the last few decades and put them at a disadvantage in comparison to some of the populous northern states like Uttar Pradesh.

The bigger controversy about the 15th Finance Commission that the southern states complain about is that the large and populous states like Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh have been faring poorly in India’s direct tax revenue. Bihar being the third largest populous state contributes barely 0.65%.

However, when it comes to population control and decent tax contribution, the southern states have been fairing well compared to the northern states. A region-wise division of direct tax contribution shows that the five southern states — Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Kerala — contributed 23% to India’s direct tax revenue.

According to Central Board of Direct Taxes data, Andhra Pradesh contributed Rs 220,823.54 crore in taxes from 2013-14 to 2018-19.

Andhra Pradesh alone accounts for 4.4% which is the lowest amongst the southern states. Nevertheless, considering the lack of a revenue generating capital, the state requires a larger share of the tax share compared to its neighbouring counterparts.

Compared to other neighbouring states, Andhra Pradesh’s focus hasn’t been on getting a better deal from the financial commission. It is about getting the Special Category Status (SCS) which the same commission had refused them that would give them tax incentives and bigger revenue share. The revenue deficit of the state government for the first two quarters (April to September) of the current financial year (2019-20) stood at Rs 7,649.79 crore while the fiscal deficit stood at Rs 15,842 crore.

Title: Released AP fishermen to reach today
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The eight AP fishermen who were released from Bangladesh jail on Wednesday are likely to reach the city on Tuesday morning. “They started their homeward journey from Mongla port on Wednesday but their boat developed a snag, for which they had to anchor at Kakdwip in West Bengal and take a train from Kolkata,” AP Matsyakara Samakhya president Vasupalli Janakiram, who went to Bangladesh to secure their release, said.

A team is expected to go to Kakdwip later this month to bring back the boat after carrying out the repairs. All eight fishermen are from Thippalavalasa village Vizianagaram district, but have been living in the city with their families for many years now. On October 3 last year, their boat Amrutha strayed into Bangladesh waters while they had gone fishing. They were detained by the neighbouring country’s coast guard and had been languishing in a jail there since then. “They faced a tough time in jail. Proper drinking water was not available and we had to purchase water for them. They also faced problems with food as the food habits in Bangladesh are different to what we eat here,” added Janakiram.

Title: Donald Trump may start India visit from Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from February 4, 2020

US President Donald Trump. (Photo: Reuters)

NEW DELHI: As preparations pick up for US President Donald Trump’s visit later this month, it is learnt that he is likely to land in Ahmedabad on February 23 where, apart from visiting Gandhi’s Sabarmati Ashram, he may address a town hall-like event.

The event is likely to include Prime Minister Narendra Modi as well, and might be even bigger than the ‘Howdy Modi’ function in Houston last year. The US advance team to finalize preparations are expected to arrive this week.

Trump is likely to come to Delhi that evening, beginning his official visit on February 24. It is unclear whether he will come with wife Melania or daughter Ivanka, who has already visited India, representing her father at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Hyderabad in 2017.

After his official engagements, which include talks with Modi and a banquet at Rashtrapati Bhavan among others, Trump may make a short trip to Agra to see the Taj Mahal.

The visit will be Trump’s first to India as president, and has acquired significance since he will be coming just after a bruising impeachment trial and in an election year. The US goes to polls in November, but the gruelling primary season is scheduled to start by the month-end. The US and India are expected to conclude a limited trade deal during Trump’s visit that has been in negotiations for the past few months.
